member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPortableObject
member.summary: The IPortableObject interface is implemented by .NET classes that can self-serialize and deserialize their state to and from a POF data stream.
member.remarks: The and methods of the IPortableObject interface are implemented by a class to give the class complete control its own POF serialization and deserialization.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor
member.summary: An IDeltaCompressor implementation that works with opaque (binary) values.
member.remarks:
The delta format is composed of a leading byte that indicates the format; the format indicator byte is one of the FMT_* field values. If the delta value does not begin with one of the FMT_* indicators, then the delta value is itself the new value. If the delta is null, then it indicates no change. The grammar follows:
BinaryDelta: FMT_EMPTY FMT_BINDIFF BinaryChangeList-opt OP_TERM FMT_REPLACE-opt Bytes null
BinaryChangeList: OP_EXTRACT Offset Length BinaryChangeList-opt OP_APPEND Length Bytes BinaryChangeList-opt
Offset: Length: packed-integer
Bytes: byte Bytes-opt
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2009.01.06
Aleksandar Seovic 2009.03.30

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.IDeltaCompressor
member.summary: The IDeltaCompressor interface provides the capability of comparing two in-memory buffers containing an old and a new value, and producing a result (called a "delta") that can be applied to the old value to create the new value.
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2009.01.06
Aleksandar Seovic 2009.03.30

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.IDeltaCompressor.ExtractDelta(Tangosol.Util.Binary,Tangosol.Util.Binary)

summary.p: Compare an old value to a new value and generate a delta that represents the changes that must be made to the old value in order to transform it into the new value. The generated delta must be a Binary of non-zero length.
If the old value is null, the generated delta must be a "replace", meaning that applying it to any value must produce the specified new value.

member.param: The old value.
The new value; must not be null.
member.returns: The changes that must be made to the old value in order to transform it into the new value, or null to indicate no change.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.IDeltaCompressor.ApplyDelta(Tangosol.Util.Binary,Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Apply a delta to an old value in order to create a new value.
member.param: The old value.
The delta information returned from to apply to the old value.
member.returns: The new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.FMT_EMPTY
member.summary: A format indicator (the first byte of the binary delta) that indicates that the new value is a zero-length binary value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.FMT_REPLACE
member.summary: A format indicator (the first byte of the binary delta) that indicates that the new value is found in its entirety in the delta value. In other words, other than the first byte, the delta is itself the new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.FMT_BINDIFF
member.summary: A format indicator (the first byte of the binary delta) that indicates that the new value is formed by applying a series of modifications to the old value. The possible modifications are defined by the OP_* constants.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.OP_EXTRACT
member.summary: A binary delta operator that instructs the method to extract bytes from the old value and append them to the new value. The format is the one-byte OP_EXTRACT indicator followed by a packed int offset and packed int length. The offset and length indicate the region of the old value to extract and append to the new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.OP_APPEND
member.summary: A binary delta operator that instructs the {@link #applyDelta} method to copy the following bytes from the delta value and append them to the new value. The format is the one-byte OP_APPEND indicator followed by a packed int length and then a series of bytes. The length indicates the length of the series of bytes to copy from the delta value and append to the new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.OP_TERM
member.summary: A binary delta operator that instructs the {@link #applyDelta} method that the delta has been fully applied.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.MIN_BLOCK
member.summary: Minimum length of an "extract" block to encode.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.ExtractDelta(Tangosol.Util.Binary,Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Compare an old value to a new value and generate a delta that represents the changes that must be made to the old value in order to transform it into the new value.
member.param: The old value.
The new value.
member.returns: The changes that must be made to the old value in order to transform it into the new value, or null to indicate no change.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.ApplyDelta(Tangosol.Util.Binary,Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Apply a delta to an old value in order to create a new value.
member.param: The old value.
The delta information returned from to apply to the old value.
member.returns: The new value.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.CreateDelta(Tangosol.Util.Binary,Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Actually create a delta in the binary delta format. This method is designed to be overridden by subclasses that have more intimate knowledge of the contents of the buffers.
member.param: The old value.
The new value.
member.returns: A delta in the binary delta format.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.EncodeReplace(Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Encode the passed buffer into a delta value that will cause the old value to be replaced by the value in the passed buffer.
member.param: A non-null, non-zero-length Binary
member.returns: a Binary that acts as a delta that replaces an old value with the contents of

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.EnsureWriter(Tangosol.IO.DataWriter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make sure that a DataWriter exists if one doesn't already.
member.param: The existing DataWriter or null.
The expected resulting size of the write buffer
member.returns: A DataWriter, never null

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.WriteAppend(Tangosol.IO.DataWriter,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encode a binary diff "append" operator to indicate that bytes should be appended from the delta stream to the new value.
member.param: The existing DataWriter for the diff, or null
The expected resulting size of the write buffer.
The byte array from which to get the bytes to append.
The offset of the old buffer to append.
The length of the old buffer to append.
member.returns: A DataWriter, never null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.WriteExtract(Tangosol.IO.DataWriter,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encode a binary diff "extract" operator to indicate that bytes should be copied from the old value to the new value.
member.param: The existing DataWriter for the diff, or null
The expected resulting size of the write buffer.
The offset of the old buffer to append.
The length of the old buffer to append.
member.returns: A DataWriter, never null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.FinalizeDelta(Tangosol.IO.DataWriter)
member.summary: Convert an open delta output stream into a finalized Binary delta.
member.param: The delta writer.
member.returns: Finalized Binary delta.

member.summary: An empty Binary object.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.BinaryDeltaCompressor.DELTA_TRUNCATE
member.summary: A delta value that indicates an empty new value.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.ConfigurableSerializerFactory
member.summary:
A implementation that creates instances of a Serializer class configured using an XmlElement of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT instance ((class-name | (class-factory-name, method-name), init-params?)> <!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
member.author: Wei Lin 2011.10.25

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofSerializer
member.summary: The IPofSerializer interface provides the capability of reading and writing a .NET object from and to a POF stream.
member.author: Cameron Purdy, Jason Howes 2006.07.14
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.08

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofSerializer.Serialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize a user type instance to a POF stream by writing its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for writing out an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must set the version by calling .
The implementation may write any combination of the properties of the user type by using the "write" methods of the IPofWriter, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been written, the implementation must terminate the writing of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofWriter with which to write the object's state.
The object to serialize.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofSerializer.Deserialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Deserialize a user type instance from a POF stream by reading its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for reading in an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must get the version by calling .
The implementation may read any combination of the properties of the user type by using "read" methods of the IPofReader, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes. Additionally, the implementation must call {@link IPofReader#RegisterIdentity} with the new instance prior to reading any properties which are user type instances themselves.
After all desired properties of the user type have been read, the implementation must terminate the reading of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofReader with which to read the object's state.
member.returns: The deserialized user type instance.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.param: The IPofWriter with which to write the object's state.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.ExceptionPofSerializer
member.summary: implementation that can serialize and deserialize a to/from a POF stream.

remarks.p: This serializer provides a catch-all mechanism for serializing exceptions. Any deserialized exception will loose type information, and simply be represented as a . The basic detail information of the exception is retained.
PortableException and this class work asymmetrically to provide the serialization routines for exceptions.

member.summary: Defines an interface that should be implemented by the classes that want to support evolution.

member.summary: Return holder object for the specified type id.

member.returns: IEvolvable instance for the specified type id.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IEvolvableObject.GetEvolvableHolder
member.summary: Return that should be used to store information about evolvable objects that are not known during deserialization.
member.remarks: For example, it is possible to evolve the class hierarchy by adding new classes at any level in the hierarchy. Normally this would cause a problem during deserialization on older clients that don't have new classes at all, but EvolvableHolder allows us to work around that issue and simply store type id to opaque binary value mapping within it.
member.returns: EvolvableHolder instance.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofAnnotationSerializer
member.summary: A PofAnnotationSerializer provides annotation based de/serialization.
member.remarks:
This serializer must be instantiated with the intended class which is eventually scanned for the presence of the following annotations.
This serializer supports classes iff they are annotated with the type level annotation; . This annotation is a marker annotation with no children.
All fields annotated with are explicitly deemed POF serializable with the option of specifying overrides to provide explicit behaviour such as:
Explicit POF indexes
Custom to specify concrete implementations / customizations
The (POF index) can be omitted iff the auto-indexing feature is enabled. This is enabled by instantiating this class with the autoIndex constructor argument. This feature determines the index based on any explicit indexes specified and the name of the portable properties. Currently objects with multiple versions is not supported. The following illustrates the auto index algorithm:
NameExplicit IndexDetermined Index
c11
a0
b2
NOTE: This implementation does support objects that implement Evolvable
member.author: Harvey Raja 2011.07.25

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofNavigator

member.returns: The resulting IPofValue.
member.exception: If the navigation fails; for example one of the intermediate nodes in this path is a "terminal" IPofValue.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2009.03.30

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue.GetChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Locate a child IPofValue contained within this IPofValue.
member.remarks: The returned IPofValue could represent a non-existent (null) value.
member.param: Index of the child value to get.
member.returns: The the child IPofValue.
member.exception: If this value is a "terminal" or the child value cannot be located for any other reason.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue.GetValue
member.summary: Return the deserialized value which this IPofValue represents.
member.remarks: For primitive types such as int or bool, the POF type is not stored in the POF stream. Therefore, for primitive types, the POF type or .NET type must be explicitly specified via or .
member.returns: The deserialized value.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue.GetValue(System.Type)
member.summary: Return the deserialized value which this IPofValue represents.
member.remarks: For primitive types such as int or bool, the POF type is not stored in the POF stream. Therefore, for primitive types, the type parameter must be non-null.
member.param: The required type of the returned value or null if the type is to be inferred from the serialized state.
member.returns: The deserialized value.
member.exception: If the value is incompatible with the specified type.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue.GetValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the deserialized value which this IPofValue represents.

member.returns: The deserialized value.
member.exception: If the value is incompatible with the specified type.

member.summary: Update this IPofValue.
member.remarks: The changes made using this method will be immediately reflected in the result of method, but will not be applied to the underlying POF stream until the method is invoked on the root IPofValue.
member.param: New deserialized value for this IPofValue.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.IPofValue.ApplyChanges
member.summary: Apply all the changes that were made to this value and return a binary representation of the new value.
member.remarks:
Any format prefixes and/or decorations that were present in the original buffer this value orginated from will be preserved.

member.returns: New Binary object that contains modified IPofValue.
member.exception: If called on a non-root IPofValue.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader
member.summary: The IPofReader interface provides the capability of reading a set of non-primitive .NET types ("user types") from a POF stream as an ordered sequence of indexed properties.
member.remarks: See for a complete description of the POF user type serialization format.
member.author: Cameron Purdy, Jason Howes 2006.07.13
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.08

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadBoolean(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a Boolean property from the POF stream.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadDateTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a DateTime property from the POF stream.

remarks.p: This method will attempt to read both the date and time component from the POF stream. If the value in the stream does not contain both components, the corresponding values in the returned DateTime instance will be set to default values.
If the encoded value in the POF stream contains time zone information, this method will ignore time zone information and return a literal DateTime value, as read from the stream.

member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadLocalDateTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a DateTime property from the POF stream.

remarks.p: This method will attempt to read both the date and time component from the POF stream. If the value in the stream does not contain both components, the corresponding values in the returned DateTime instance will be set to default values.
If the encoded value in the POF stream contains time zone information, this method will use it to determine and return the local time for the reading thread.

member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadUniversalDateTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a DateTime property from the POF stream.

remarks.p: This method will attempt to read both the date and time components from the POF stream. If the value in the stream does not contain both components, the corresponding values in the returned DateTime instance will be set to default values.
If the encoded value in the POF stream contains time zone information, this method will use it to determine and return a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadDate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a DateTime property from the POF stream.
member.remarks: This method will read only the date component of a date-time value from the POF stream. It will ignore the time component if present and initialize the time-related fields of the return value to their default values.
member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.RegisterIdentity(System.Object)
member.summary: Register an identity for a newly created user type instance.
member.remarks:
If identity/reference types are enabled, an identity is used to uniquely identify a user type instance within a POF stream. The identity immediately proceeds the instance value in the POF stream and can be used later in the stream to reference the instance.
IPofSerializer implementations must call this method with each user type instance instantiated during deserialization prior to reading any properties of the instance which are user type instances themselves.
member.param: The object to register the identity for.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.CreateNestedPofReader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtain an IPofReader that can be used to read a set of properties from a single property of the current user type. The returned IPofReader is only valid from the time that it is returned until the next call is made to this IPofReader.
member.param: The property index to read from.
member.returns: An IPofReader that reads its contents from a single property of this IPofReader.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property, or if no user type is being parsed.
if an I/O error occurs

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader.ReadRemainder
member.summary: Read all remaining indexed properties of the current user type from the POF stream.

remarks.p: As part of reading in a user type, this method must be called by the that is reading the user type, or the read position within the POF stream will be corrupted.
Subsequent calls to the various ReadXYZ methods of this interface will fail after this method is called.

member.returns: A Binary object containing zero or more indexed properties in binary POF encoded form, or null if no value was available in the POF stream
member.exception: If no user type is being parsed.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofStreamReader.ReadUniversalDateTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a DateTime property from the POF stream.

remarks.p: This method will attempt to read both the date and time components from the POF stream. If the value in the stream does not contain both components, the corresponding values in the returned DateTime instance will be set to default values.
If the encoded value in the POF stream contains time zone information, this method will use it to determine and return a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The DateTime property value.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.param: The property index to read.
member.returns: The RawDateTime property value, or null if no value was available in the POF stream.
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofStreamReader.RegisterIdentity(System.Object)
member.summary: Register an identity for a newly created user type instance.
member.remarks:
If identity/reference types are enabled, an identity is used to uniquely identify a user type instance within a POF stream. The identity immediately proceeds the instance value in the POF stream and can be used later in the stream to reference the instance.
IPofSerializer implementations must call this method with each user type instance instantiated during deserialization prior to reading any properties of the instance which are user type instances themselves.
member.param: The object to register the identity for.
member.exception: If no user type is being parsed.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofStreamReader.CreateNestedPofReader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtain a PofReader that can be used to read a set of properties from a single property of the current user type. The returned PofReader is only valid from the time that it is returned until the next call is made to this PofReader.
member.param: the property index to read from
member.returns: a PofReader that reads its contents from a single property of this PofReader
member.exception: If the POF stream has already advanced past the desired property, or if no user type is being parsed.
if an I/O error occurs

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.ITypeMetadata`1
member.summary: ITypeMetadata represents the definition of a type including uniqueness and all structural properties. This definition is used to uniformly define types and their internal structures. Uniformity in this context is in relation to the supported languages.
member.remarks: This interface defines the contract required by users of TypeMetadata. This includes the ability to have a predictable order for both getter and setter methods, the ability to retrieve a method, and to create a new instance of a type this metadata describes.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.NameManglers.PropertyMangler
member.summary: A implementation that is aware of property naming conventions and is able to convert from a method name to a generic name.
member.remarks: The convention this mangler is aware of is property names being equivalent to the required name except with the first character being in upper case, e.g. Foo will be converted to foo.
member.author: Harvey Raja 2011.07.25

member.summary: Convert the given string to a new string using a convention determined by the implementer.
member.param: Original string.
member.returns: Mangled string.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.NameManglers.FieldMangler
member.summary: A implementation that is aware of field naming conventions and is able to convert from a field name to a generic name.
member.remarks: The conventions this mangler is aware of are prefixing variables with m_. For example m_bar and would be converted to a mangled name of bar.
member.author: Harvey Raja 2011.07.25

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.NameManglers.FieldMangler.Mangle(System.String)
member.summary: Convert the given string to a new string using a convention determined by the implementer.
member.param: Original string.
member.returns: Mangled string.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.NameManglers.MethodMangler
member.summary: A implementation that is aware of method naming conventions and is able to convert from a method name to a generic name.
member.remarks: The conventions this mangler is aware of are the getter and setter style methods, e.g. getBar or setBar which are both converted to a mangled name of bar.
member.author: Harvey Raja 2011.07.25

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.Reflection.Internal.NameManglers.MethodMangler.Mangle(System.String)
member.summary: Convert the given string to a new string using a convention determined by the implementer.
member.param: Original string.
member.returns: Mangled string.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PrincipalPofSerializer
member.summary: implementation that supports the serialization and deserialization of an to and from a POF stream.

remarks.p: Only the IIdentity associated with the IPrincipal is serialized. All role information encapsulated by the IPrincipal is considered transient.
The PrincipalPofSerializer can serialize any IPrincipal implementation to a POF stream; however, the IPrincipal returned during deserialization is always an instance of with an empty role array.

member.author: Jason Howes 2008.08.12

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PrincipalPofSerializer.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PrincipalPofSerializer.Serialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize a user type instance to a POF stream by writing its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for writing out an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must set the version by calling .
The implementation may write any combination of the properties of the user type by using the "write" methods of the IPofWriter, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been written, the implementation must terminate the writing of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofWriter with which to write the object's state.
The object to serialize.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PrincipalPofSerializer.Deserialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Deserialize a user type instance from a POF stream by reading its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for reading in an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must get the version by calling .
The implementation may read any combination of the properties of the user type by using "read" methods of the IPofReader, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been read, the implementation must terminate the reading of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofReader with which to read the object's state.
member.returns: The deserialized user type instance.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.SafeConfigurablePofContext
member.summary: SafeConfigurablePofContext is an extension of ConfigurablePofContext that can serialize and deserialize any valid POF user type, even those that have not been explicitly configured, as well as any .NET serializable types.
member.author: Jason Howes 2007.05.03
Aleksandar Seovic (.NET) 2009.09.25

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.ConfigurablePofContext
member.summary: This class implements the interface using information provided in a configuration file (or in a passed XML configuration).

remarks.p:
For each user type supported by this POF context, it must be provided with:
A valid user type ID that is unique within this POF context.
A .NET type name that identifies a .NET type or interface that all values of the user type are type-assignable to (and that no values of other user types are type-assignable to); in other words, all values of the user type (and no values of other user types) are instances of the specified class, instances of a sub-class of the specified class, or (if it is an interface) instances of a class that implements the specified interface.
A .NET type name that identifies a non-abstract implementation of the interface.

The format of the configuration XML is as follows:
<pof-config> <user-type-list> .. <user-type> <type-id>53</type-id> <class-name>My.Example.Data.Trade, MyAssembly</class-name> <serializer> <class-name>Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer, Coherence</class-name> <init-params> <init-param> <param-type>System.Int32</param-type> <param-value>{type-id}</param-value> </init-param> </init-params> </serializer> </user-type>
<user-type> <type-id>54</type-id> <class-name>My.Example.Data.Position, MyAssembly</class-name> </user-type>
.. <include>file:/my-pof-config.xml</include>
.. </user-type-list>
<allow-interfaces>false</allow-interfaces> <allow-subclasses>false</allow-subclasses>
<default-serializer> <class-name>Tangosol.IO.Pof.XmlPofSerializer, Coherence</class-name> <init-params> <init-param> <param-type>System.Int32</param-type> <param-value>{type-id}</param-value> </init-param> </init-params> </default-serializer> </pof-config>

For each user type, a user-type element must exist inside the user-type-list element. The user-type-list element contains up to three elements, in the following order:
The user-type element should contain a type-id element whose value specifies the unique integer type ID; if none of the user-type elements contains a type-id element, then the type IDs for the user types will be based on the order in which they appear in the configuration, with the first user type being assigned the type ID 0, the second user type being assigned the type ID 1, and so on. (It is strongly recommended that user types IDs always be specified, in order to support schema versioning and evolution.)
The class-name element is required, and specifies the fully qualified name of the .NET type or interface that all values of the user type are type-assignable to.
The serializer element is used to specify an implementation of IPofSerializer to use to serialize and deserialize user type values to and from a POF stream. Within the serializer element, the class-name element is required, and zero or more constructor parameters can be defined within an init-params block. If no serializer is specified, then the default-serializer is used if one is specified, otherwise the user type is assumed to implement the interface or have a . If the former, a will be used. If the later, a will be used.

The optional include element allows user-type elements defined in another configuration XML to be added to the user type list. The value of this element is a locator string (either a valid path or URL) that specifies the location of the target IPofContext configuration file. The user-type elements of the target file are imported verbatum; therefore, if the included elements contain explicit type identifiers, each identifier must be unique with respect to the the user type identifiers (either explicit or generated) defined within the including file. If the included user types do not contain explicit type identifiers, then the type identifiers will be based on the order in which the user types appear in the composite configuration file. Multiple include elements may be used within a single user-type-list element.

In order to be used by the ConfigurablePofContext, a IPofSerializer implementation must provide a public constructor that accepts the parameters detailed by the init-params element. The parameter values, as specified by the param-value element, can specify one of the following substitutable values:
{type-id} replaced with the Type ID of the User Type
{class-name}
replaced with the name of the class for the User Type
{class} replaced with the Type for the User Type

If the init-params element is not present, then the ConfigurablePofContext attempts to construct the IPofSerializer by searching for one of the following constructors in the same order as they appear here:
(int typeId, Type type)
(int typeId)
()
Once constructed, if the IPofSerializer implements the interface, the property is set to the passed XML information, transposed as described by , and as described in the pof-config.xsd file.

member.remarks: The initial contents of the map reflect the configuration, but the contents can increase over time as the names of sub-classes (i.e. of the classes corresponding to the contained class names) are resolved to type IDs (and those mappings are added).

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.FindElement(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,System.String)
member.summary: Find a child element with the specified '/'-delimited path.
member.remarks:
The path format is based on a subset of the XPath specification, supporting:
Leading '/' to specify root
Use of '/' as a path delimiter
Use of '..' to specify parent
If multiple child elements exist that have the specified name, then the behavior of this method is undefined, and it is permitted to return any one of the matching elements, to return null, or to throw an arbitrary runtime exception.
member.param: An .
The path to follow to find the desired XML element.
member.returns: The child element with the specified path or null if such a child element does not exist.

member.remarks:
The path format is based on a subset of the XPath specification, supporting:
Leading '/' to specify root
Use of '/' as a path delimiter
Use of '..' to specify parent
If multiple child elements exist that have the specified name and value, then this method returns any one of the matching elements.
member.param: An .
The path to follow to find the desired XML element.
The value to match.
member.returns: The child element with the specified path and value or null if the such a child element does not exist.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.OverrideElement(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
member.summary: Override the values of the specified base element with values from the specified override element.
member.remarks:
The values are only overriden if there is an exact match between the element paths and all attribute values. Empty override values are ignored. Override elements that do not match any of the base elements are just copied over. No ambiguity is allowed.
For example, if the base element has more then one child with the same name and attributes then the override is not allowed.
member.param: Base .
Override IXmlElement.
member.exception: If the base element is immutable or there is ambiguity between the override and base elements.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.OverrideElement(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,System.String)
member.summary: Override the values of the specified base element with values from the specified override element.
member.remarks:
The values are only overriden if there is an exact match between the element paths and an attribute value for the specified attribute name. Empty override values are ignored. Override elements that do not match any of the base elements are just copied over. No ambiguity is allowed.
For example, if the base element has more then one child with the same name and the specified attribute's value then the override is not allowed.
member.param: Base .
Override IXmlElement.
Attribute name that serves as an identifier allowing to match elements with the same name; if not specified all attributes have to match for an override.
member.exception: If the base element is immutable or there is ambiguity between the override and base elements.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseInitParams(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
member.summary:
Parse the specified "init-params" element of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
into an object array.
member.remarks:
For the purpose of this method only the parameters that have the "param-type" element specified are processed. The following types are supported:
string (a.k.a. System.String)
bool (a.k.a. System.Boolean)
int (a.k.a. System.Int32)
long (a.k.a. System.Int64)
float (a.k.a. System.Single)
double (a.k.a. System.Double)
decimal (a.k.a. System.Decimal)
file (a.k.a. System.IO.File)
date (a.k.a. System.DateTime)
time (a.k.a. System.DateTime
xml (a.k.a. Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
For any other [explicitly specified] types the corresponding "init-param" IXmlElement itself is placed into the returned array.
member.param: The "init-params" IXmlElement to parse.
member.returns: An array of parameters.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseInitParams(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.IParameterResolver)
member.summary:
Parse the specified "init-params" element of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
into an object array.
member.remarks:
For the purpose of this method only the parameters that have the "param-type" element specified are processed. The following types are supported:
string (a.k.a. System.String)
bool (a.k.a. System.Boolean)
int (a.k.a. System.Int32)
long (a.k.a. System.Int64)
double (a.k.a. System.Double)
float (a.k.a. System.Single)
decimal (a.k.a. System.Decimal)
file (a.k.a. System.IO.File)
date (a.k.a. System.DateTime)
time (a.k.a. System.DateTime
xml (a.k.a. Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
For any other [explicitly specified] types the corresponding "init-param" IXmlElement itself is placed into the returned array.
member.param: The "init-params" IXmlElement to parse.
An to resolve "{macro}" values (optional).
member.returns: An array of parameters.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.TransformInitParams(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
member.summary:
Transform the specified "init-params" element of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
into an XML element composed of the corrsponding names. For example, the "init-params" element of the following structure:
<init-param> <param-name>NameOne</param-name> <param-value>ValueOne</param-value> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>NameTwo</param-name> <param-value>ValueTwo</param-value> </init-param>
will transform into
<NameOne>ValueOne</NameOne> <NameTwo>ValueTwo</NameTwo>
member.remarks: For the purpose of this method only the parameters that have the "param-name" element specified are processed.
member.param: The XML element to insert the transformed elements into.
The "init-params" IXmlElement to parse.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.CreateInstance(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement,Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.IParameterResolver)
member.summary:
Create an instance of the class configured using an of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT ... (class-name | (class-factory-name, method-name), init-params?> <!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
As of Coherence 12.1.2 the supplied element may also be of the following format:
<!ELEMENT instance>
where the "instance" format is the same as above.
member.param: The XML element that contains the instantiation info.
An to resolve "{macro}" values (optional).
member.returns: An object intantiated or obtained based on the class configuration.

member.summary:
Create an instance of the class configured using an of the following structure:
<!ELEMENT ... (class-name | (class-factory-name, method-name), init-params?> <!ELEMENT init-params (init-param*)> <!ELEMENT init-param ((param-name | param-type), param-value, description?)>
As of Coherence 12.1.2 the supplied element may also be of the following format:

where the "instance" format is the same as above.
member.param: The XML element that contains the instantiation info.

member.returns: An object intantiated or obtained based on the class configuration.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseMemorySize(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the given string representation of a number of bytes.
member.remarks:
The supplied string must be in the format:
[\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[K|k|M|m|G|g|T|t]?[B|b]? where the first non-digit (from left to right) indicates the factor with which the preceeding decimal value should be multiplied:
K or k (kilo, 210)
M or m (mega, 220)
G or g (giga, 230)
T or t (tera, 240)
If the string value does not contain a factor, a factor of one is assumed.
The optional last character B or b indicates a unit of bytes.
member.param: A string with the format [\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[K|k|M|m|G|g|T|t]?[B|b]?
member.returns: The number of bytes represented by the given string.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseMemorySize(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parse the given string representation of a number of bytes.
member.remarks:
The supplied string must be in the format:
[\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[K|k|M|m|G|g|T|t]?[B|b]? where the first non-digit (from left to right) indicates the factor with which the preceeding decimal value should be multiplied:
K or k (kilo, 210)
M or m (mega, 220)
G or g (giga, 230)
T or t (tera, 240)
If the string value does not contain an explict or implicit factor, a factor calculated by raising 2 to the given default power is used. The default power can be one of:
The optional last character B or b indicates a unit of bytes.
member.param: A string with the format [\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[K|k|M|m|G|g|T|t]?[B|b]?
The exponent used to calculate the factor used in the conversion if one is not implied by the given string.
member.returns: The number of bytes represented by the given string.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseTime(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the given string representation of a time duration and return its value as a number of milliseconds.
member.remarks:
The supplied string must be in the format:
[\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[MS|ms|S|s|M|m|H|h|D|d]?
where the first non-digits (from left to right) indicate the unit of time duration:
MS or ms (milliseconds)
S or s (seconds)
M or m (minutes)
H or h (hours)
D or d (days)
If the string value does not contain a unit, a unit of milliseconds is assumed.
member.param: A string with the format [\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[MS|ms|S|s|M|m|H|h|D|d]?
member.returns: The number of milliseconds represented by the given string.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.ParseTime(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parse the given string representation of a time duration and return its value as a number of milliseconds.
member.remarks:
The supplied string must be in the format:
[\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[MS|ms|S|s|M|m|H|h|D|d]?
where the first non-digits (from left to right) indicate the unit of time duration:
MS or ms (milliseconds)
S or s (seconds)
M or m (minutes)
H or h (hours)
D or d (days)
If the string value does not contain a unit, the specified default unit is assumed. The default unit can be one of:
member.param: A string with the format [\d]+[[.][\d]+]?[MS|ms|S|s|M|m|H|h|D|d]?
The unit to use in the conversion to milliseconds if one is not specified in the supplied string.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds represented by the given string.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.HashElement(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
member.summary: Provide a hash value for the XML element and all of its contained information.
member.remarks:
The hash value is defined as a xor of the following:
the GetHashCode() from the element's value (i.e. base.GetHashCode())
the GetHashCode() from each attribute name
the GetHashCode() from each attribute value
the GetHashCode() from each sub-element
member.param: The .
member.returns: The hash value for the XML element.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Run.Xml.XmlHelper.HashValue(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlValue)
member.summary: Provide a hash value for the XML value.
member.remarks:
The hash value is defined as one of the following:
0 if returns null
otherwise the hash value is the GetHashCode() of the string representation of the value
member.param: The .
member.returns: The hash value for the XML value.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.SerializationHelper.SerializationFormat
member.summary: Serialization format.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.SerializationHelper.SerializationFormat.FMT_IDO
member.summary: Serialization format: Integer-decorated value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.SerializationHelper.SerializationFormat.FMT_BIN_DECO
member.summary: Serialization format: Decorated Binary value.

remarks.p: Structure is: byte 0 : format identifier (18) byte 1 : bit mask of decoration identifiers byte 2 : packed int specifying the length of the first decorator byte next : binary data ...
For each decorator, there is a packed int for its length, followed by its binary data. The first decorator is the decorated value itself, if present.
Note: FMT_IDO cannot be combined with FMT_BIN_DECO.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.SerializationHelper.SerializationFormat.FMT_BIN_EXT_DECO
member.summary: Serialization format: Extended Decorated Binary value.

remarks.p: Structure is: byte 0 : format identifier (19) byte 1... : a packed long as bit mask byte next : packed int specifying the length of the first decorator byte next : binary data ...
For each decorator, there is a packed int for its length, followed by its binary data. The first decorator is the decorated value itself, if present.
Note: FMT_IDO cannot be combined with FMT_BIN_EXT_DECO.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.SerializationHelper.SerializationFormat.FMT_EXT
member.summary: Serialization format: A default serializer is NOT used.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.SafeConfigurablePofContext.DotNetPofSerializer.Serialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize a user type instance to a POF stream by writing its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for writing out an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must set the version by calling .
The implementation may write any combination of the properties of the user type by using the "write" methods of the IPofWriter, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been written, the implementation must terminate the writing of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofWriter with which to write the object's state.
The object to serialize.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.SafeConfigurablePofContext.DotNetPofSerializer.Deserialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Deserialize a user type instance from a POF stream by reading its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for reading in an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must get the version by calling .
The implementation may read any combination of the properties of the user type by using "read" methods of the IPofReader, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been read, the implementation must terminate the reading of the user type by calling .
member.param: The IPofReader with which to read the object's state.
member.returns: The deserialized user type instance.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.IEvolvable
member.summary: The IEvolvable interface is implemented by types that require forwards- and backwards-compatibility of their serialized form.
member.remarks:
An IEvolvable class has an integer version identifier n, where n >= 0. When the contents and/or semantics of the serialized form of the IEvolvable class changes, the version identifier is increased. Two versions identifiers, n1 and n2, indicate the same version if n1 == n2; the version indicated by n2 is newer than the version indicated by n1 if n2 > n1.
The IEvolvable interface is designed to support the evolution of types by the addition of data. Removal of data cannot be safely accomplished as long as a previous version of the type exists that relies on that data. Modifications to the structure or semantics of data from previous versions likewise cannot be safely accomplished as long as a previous version of the type exists that relies on the previous structure or semantics of the data.
When an IEvolvable object is deserialized, it retains any unknown data that has been added to newer versions of the type, and the version identifier for that data format. When the IEvolvable object is subsequently serialized, it includes both that version identifier and the unknown future data.
When an IEvolvable object is deserialized from a data stream whose version identifier indicates an older version, it must default and/or calculate the values for any data fields and properties that have been added since that older version. When the IEvolvable object is subsequently serialized, it includes its own version identifier and all of its data. Note that there will be no unknown future data in this case; future data can only exist when the version of the data stream is newer than the version of the IEvolvable type.
member.author: Cameron Purdy, Jason Howes 2006.07.14
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.12

member.name: P:Tangosol.IO.IEvolvable.ImplVersion

member.value: The serialization version supported by this object.

member.remarks: If the object was constructed (not deserialized), the data version is the same as the implementation version.
member.value: The version of the data used to initialize this object, greater than or equal to zero.
member.exception: If the specified version is negative.
If the object is not in a state in which the version can be set, for example outside of deserialization.

member.value: Future data in binary form.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.IInvocable
member.summary: An IInvocable object is a portable object that can be invoked on the remote cluster member to which the client is connected and can optionally register a return value for the invocation.
member.remarks:
When an IInvocable object is received for execution, the order of execution is:
The IInvocable object is deserialized by the .
The IInvocationService provides a reference to itself to the IInvocable object by calling the init method.
The IInvocationService invokes the IInvocable object by calling the run method.
If the IInvocationService is responsible for returning a value from the invocation, it obtains the value from the Result property.
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2003.01.05
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.09.01

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.IPriorityTask
member.summary: The IPriorityTask interface allows to control the ordering in which a service schedules tasks for execution using a thread pool and limit their execution times to a specified duration.

remarks.p: Instances of IPriorityTask typically also implement either or interface.

In addition to allowing control of the task execution (as scheduled and measured on the server side), the IPriorityTask interface could also be used to control the request time from the calling thread perspective (measured on the client). A best effort will be made to limit the request time (the time period that the calling thread is blocked waiting for a response from the corresponding service) to the value of the property.

It should be noted that the request timeout value (RT) could be grater than, equal to or less than the task execution timeout value (ET). The value of RT which is less than ET indicates that even though the task execution is allowed to take longer period of time, the client thread will not wait for a result of the execution and will be able to handle a timeout exception if it arises. Since the time spent by the task waiting in the service backlog queue does not count toward the task execution time, a value of RT that is equal or slightly greater than ET still leaves a possibility that the client thread will throw a TimeoutException before the task completes its execution normally on a server.

member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2006.11.02
Ana Cikic 2007.05.17

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.IPriorityTask.RunCanceled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method will be called if and only if all attempts to interrupt this task were unsuccesful in stopping the execution or if the execution was canceled before it had a chance to run at all.
member.remarks: Since this method is usually called on a service thread, implementors must exercise extreme caution since any delay introduced by the implementation will cause a delay of the corresponding service.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IPriorityTask.SchedulingPriority
member.summary: This task's scheduling priority.
member.value: One of the constants.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IPriorityTask.ExecutionTimeoutMillis
member.summary: The maximum amount of time this task is allowed to run before the corresponding service will attempt to stop it.

remarks.p: The value of indicates a default timeout value configured for the corresponding service; the value of indicates that this task can execute indefinitely.

If, by the time the specified amount of time passed, the task has not finished, the service will attempt to stop the execution by using the Thread.Interrupt() method. In the case that interrupting the thread does not result in the task's termination, the method will be called.

member.value: The execution timeout value in millisecods or one of the special values.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IPriorityTask.RequestTimeoutMillis
member.summary: The maximum amount of time a calling thread is willing to wait for a result of the request execution.
member.value: The request timeout value in milliseconds or one of the special values.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.DataReader
member.summary: BinaryReader extension that adds methods for reading 32 and 64-bit integer values in a packed format.

remarks.p: The "packed" format includes a sign bit (0x40) and a continuation bit (0x80) in the first byte, followed by the least 6 significant bits of the int value. Subsequent bytes (each appearing only if the previous byte had its continuation bit set) include a continuation bit (0x80) and the next least 7 significant bits of the int value.
In this way, a 32-bit value is encoded into 1-5 bytes, and 64-bit value is encoded into 1-10 bytes, depending on the magnitude of the value being encoded.

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.09
Ivan Cikic 2006.08.09

remarks.p: The "packed" format includes a sign bit (0x40) and a continuation bit (0x80) in the first byte, followed by the least 6 significant bits of the int value. Subsequent bytes (each appearing only if the previous byte had its continuation bit set) include a continuation bit (0x80) and the next least 7 significant bits of the int value. In this way, a 32-bit value is encoded into 1-5 bytes, depending on the magnitude of the value being encoded.

member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofHandler.RegisterIdentity(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is invoked when an identity is encountered in the POF stream.
member.remarks: The identity is used to uniquely identify the next value in the POF stream, and can be later referenced by the method.
member.param: If (id >= 0), then this is the identity encountered in the POF stream, otherwise it is an indicator that the following value could have been assigned an identifier but was not (i.e. that the subsequent value is of a referenceable data type).

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofHandler.EndComplexValue
member.summary: Signifies the termination of the current complex value.
member.remarks: Complex values are any of the collection, array, map and user types. For each call to one of the "begin" methods, there will be a corresponding call to this method, even if there were no contents in the complex value.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter
member.summary: The IPofWriter interface provides the capability of writing a set of non-primitive .NET types ("user types") to a POF stream as an ordered sequence of indexed properties.

remarks.p:
The serialized format of a POF user type is as follows:
Type Identifier
Version Identifier
[Property Index, Property Value]*
-1

The type identifier is an integer value greater than or equal to zero that identifies the non-primitive .NET type. The type identifier has no explicit or self-describing meaning within the POF stream itself; in other words, the type identifier does not contain the actual class definition. Instead, the IPofWriter and corresponding share an which contains the necessary meta-data, including type identifier to .NET type mappings.

The version identifier is used to support both backwards and forwards compatibility of serialized POF user types. Versioning of user types allows the addition of new properties to a user type, but not the replacement or removal of properties that existed in a previous version of the user type.

When a version v1 of a user type written by a IPofWriter is read by an IPofReader that supports version v2 of the same user type, the IPofReader returns default values for the additional properties of the User Type that exist in v2 but do not exist in v1. Conversely, when a version v2 of a user type written by a IPofWriter is read by an IPofReader that supports version v1 of the same user type, the instance of user type v1 must store those additional opaque properties for later encoding. The IPofReader enables the user type to store off the opaque properties in binary form (see ).

When the user type is re-encoded, it must be done so using the version identifier v2, since it is including the unaltered v2 properties. The opaque properties are subsequently included in the POF stream using the method.

Following the version identifier is an ordered sequence of index/value pairs, each of which is composed of a property index encoded as non-negative integer value whose value is greater than the previous property index, and a property value encoded as a POF value. The user type is finally terminated with an illegal property index of -1.
Note: To read a property that was written using a IPofWriter method, the corresponding read method on must be used. For example, if a property was written using , must be used to read the property.

member.author: Cameron Purdy, Jason Howes 2006.07.13
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.08

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter.WriteRemainder(Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Write the remaining properties to the POF stream, terminating the writing of the currrent user type.

remarks.p: As part of writing out a user type, this method must be called by the that is writing out the user type, or the POF stream will be corrupted.

Calling this method terminates the current user type by writing a -1 to the POF stream after the last indexed property. Subsequent calls to the various WriteXYZ methods of this interface will fail after this method is called.

member.param: A Binary object containing zero or more indexed properties in binary POF encoded form; may be null.
member.exception: If no user type is being written.
If an I/O error occurs.

The minute value between 0 and 59, inclusive.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofStreamWriter.WriteRemainder(Tangosol.Util.Binary)
member.summary: Write the remaining properties to the POF stream, terminating the writing of the currrent user type.

remarks.p: As part of writing out a user type, this method must be called by the that is writing out the user type, or the POF stream will be corrupted.

Calling this method terminates the current user type by writing a -1 to the POF stream after the last indexed property. Subsequent calls to the various WriteXYZ methods of this interface will fail after this method is called.

member.param: A Binary object containing zero or more indexed properties in binary POF encoded form; may be null.
member.exception: If no user type is being written.
If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PofStreamWriter.UserTypeWriter
member.summary: The UserTypeWriter implementation is a contextually-aware whose purpose is to write the properties of a value of a specified user type.

remarks.p: The "contextual awareness" refers to the fact that the UserTypeWriter maintains state about the type identifier, the PofWriter's property index position within the user type value, and an that may differ from the IPofContext that provided the which is using this UserTypeWriter to serialize a user type.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer
member.summary: implementation that supports the serialization and deserialization of any class that implements to and from a POF stream.
member.author: Jason Howes 2006.07.18
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.08.12

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new PortableObjectSerializer for the user type with the given type identifier.
member.param: The user type identifier.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer.Serialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize a user type instance to a POF stream by writing its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for writing out an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must set the version by calling .
The implementation may write any combination of the properties of the user type by using the "write" methods of the IPofWriter, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been written, the implementation must terminate the writing of the user type by calling .
member.param: The with which to write the object's state.
The object to serialize.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer.Deserialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Deserialize a user type instance from a POF stream by reading its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for reading in an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must get the version by calling .
The implementation may read any combination of the properties of the user type by using "read" methods of the IPofReader, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been read, the implementation must terminate the reading of the user type by calling .
member.param: The with which to read the object's state.
member.returns: The deserialized user type instance.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer.Initialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPortableObject,Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Initialize the specified (newly instantiated) PortableObject instance using the specified reader.
member.param: The object to initialize.
The PofReader with which to read the object's state.

member.name: F:Tangosol.IO.Pof.PortableObjectSerializer.m_typeId
member.summary: The type identifier of the user type to serialize and deserialize.

The day number between 1 and 31 inclusive as defined by ISO8601.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.WritingPofHandler.BeginUserType(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Report that a value of a "user type" has been encountered in the POF stream.

remarks.p: A user type is analogous to a "class", and a value of a user type is analogous to an "object".
This method call will be followed by a separate call to an "on" or "begin" method for each of the property values in the user type, and the user type will then be terminated by a call to .

member.param: Context-sensitive position information: property position within a user type, array position within an array, element counter within a collection, entry counter within a map, -1 otherwise.
Identity of the object to encode, or -1 if identity shouldn't be encoded in the POF stream.
The user type identifier, (userTypeId >= 0).
The version identifier for the user data type data in the POF stream, (versionId >= 0).

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Pof.WritingPofHandler.EndComplexValue
member.summary: Signifies the termination of the current complex value.
member.remarks: Complex values are any of the collection, array, map and user types. For each call to one of the "begin" methods, there will be a corresponding call to this method, even if there were no contents in the complex value.

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Resources.AbstractResource
member.summary: Asbtract base class for other implementations.
member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.10.07

member.name: T:Tangosol.IO.Resources.IResource
member.summary: Interface for access to different types of resources that can provide a System.IO.Stream to read from.
member.remarks: This interface encapsulates a resource descriptor that abstracts away from the underlying type of resource; possible resource types include files, URLs, web resources and assmbly embedded resources.
member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.10.07

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Resources.IResource.GetStream
member.summary: Opens an input stream for this resource.

remarks.note: Clients of this interface must be aware that every call of this method will create a fresh System.IO.Stream; it is the responsibility of the calling code to close any such System.IO.Stream.

member.returns: A System.IO.Stream.
member.exception: If the stream could not be opened.

member.name: P:Tangosol.IO.Resources.IResource.Uri
member.summary: Gets the fully qualified URI for this .
member.remarks: Fuly qualified URI for a resource is the name of the resource as specified, with a protocol name prepended if necessary.
member.value: The fully qualified resource URI.

member.name: P:Tangosol.IO.Resources.IResource.AbsolutePath
member.summary: Gets an absolute path of this resource.
member.remarks:
The exact value returned will depend on the specific resource implementation.
For example, file system-based resources that support relative path resolution, such as and , should return an absolute path of the resource on the file system. Other resource types should return fully qualified URI for the resource, which is basically the value of the property.
member.value: The absolute path of this resource.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Resources.AbstractResource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes resource name and creates a new instance of the AbstractResource class.
member.remarks: Since this is an abstract class it does not expose any public constructors.
member.param: A String representing the resource.
member.exception: If is null or it contains only whitespace character(s).

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Resources.AbstractResource.GetStream
member.summary: Opens an input stream for this resource.
member.returns: A System.IO.Stream.
member.exception: If the stream could not be opened.

member.summary: Strips protocol name (if present) from the .
member.param: Resource name.
member.returns: Resource name without the protocol name.

member.name: M:Tangosol.IO.Resources.AbstractResource.ToString
member.summary: Returns the textual information about this resource.
member.returns: Human readable description of this resource.

member.summary: Compares specified with the current object.
member.remarks: This implementation compares values.

member.returns: true if this resource and the passed object are equivalent.

assembly://assemblyName/namespace/resourceName

If the assembly specified in the supplied was loaded twice with two different evidences.
If the assembly specified in the supplied could not be found.
If the caller does not have the required permission to load the assembly specified in the supplied .

member.exception: If the stream could not be opened.

remarks.p: Uses the System.Web.HttpContext.Current.Server.MapPath method to resolve the file name for a given resource.
Note that the WebResource is resolved in the context of the HTTP request it is constructed in, which means that the relative paths will be resolved relative to the requested web page.
If you want the resource to be resolved relative to the web application root, make sure that you prefix resource name with a tilde (~) character:

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.CacheFactory
member.summary: Factory for the Oracle Coherence for .NET product.

remarks.p: One of the most common functions provided by the CacheFactory is ability to obtain an instance of a cache. There are various cache services and cache topologies that are supported by Coherence.
To get a cache reference use the method.
This approach that has a lot of advantages over service type specific methods described further below because:

list.item: complex cache topology could be configured declaratively in the cache configuration XML rather then programmaticaly via API;
the caller's code could become completely generic and agnostic to the cache topology;
the cache topology decision could be deferred and made much later in the development cycle without changing the application code.

remarks.p: When a cache is no longer used, it is preferrable to call to release the associated resources. To destroy all instances of the cache across the cluster, use .
Other services:

item.description:
Invocation service provides the means for invoking and monitoring execution of classes on specified nodes across a cluster.
The following factory method returns an instance of Invocation service:

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.CacheFactory.GetCache(System.String)
member.summary: Return an instance of a cache configured by the current .
member.remarks: This helper method is a simple wrapper around method.
member.param: Cache name (unique for a given configurable cache factory). If the with the specified name already exists, a reference to the same object will be returned.
member.returns: The INamedCache object.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.CacheFactory.ReleaseCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release local resources associated with the specified instance of the cache.
member.remarks:
This invalidates a reference obtained by using one of the factory methods (GetReplicatedCache, GetOptimisticCache).
Releasing an reference makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the content of the cache. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.CacheFactory.DestroyCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Releases and destroys the specified .
member.remarks: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be destroyed.

method.

member.returns: The IService object.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.AbstractCacheStore.StoreAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Store the specified values under the specified keys in the underlying store.

remarks.p: This method is intended to support both key/value creation and value update for the specified keys.
The implementation of this method calls for each entry in the supplied IDictionary. Once stored successfully, an entry is removed from the IDictionary (if possible).
Note: For many types of persistent stores, a single store operation is as expensive as a bulk store operation; therefore, subclasses should override this method if possible.

member.param: An of any number of keys and values to store.
member.exception: If this implementation or the underlying store is read-only.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCache
member.summary: implementation that wraps two caches - a front cache (assumed to be "inexpensive" and probably "incomplete") and a back cache (assumed to be "complete" and "correct", but more "expensive") - using a read-through/write-through approach.

remarks.p:
If the back cache implements interface, the CompositeCache provides four different strategies of invalidating the front cache entries that have changed by other processes in the back cache:
strategy instructs the cache not to listen for invalidation events at all. This is the best choice for raw performance and scalability when business requirements permit the use of data which might not be absolutely current. Freshness of data can be guaranteed by use of a sufficiently brief eviction policy for the front cache.
strategy instructs the CompositeCache to listen to the back cache events related only to the items currently present in the front cache. This strategy works best when each instance of a front cache contains distinct subset of data relative to the other front cache instances (e.g. sticky data access patterns).
strategy instructs the CompositeCache to listen to all back cache events. This strategy is optimal for read-heavy tiered access patterns where there is significant overlap between the different instances of front caches.
strategy instructs the CompositeCache implementation to switch automatically between ListenPresent and ListenAll strategies based on the cache statistics.
strategy instructs the CompositeCache to listen to all back map events that are not synthetic. A synthetic event could be emitted as a result of eviction or expiration. With this invalidation stategy, it is possible for the front map to contain cache entries that have been synthetically removed from the back (though any subsequent re-insertion will cause the corresponding entries in the front map to be invalidated).
The front cache implementation is assumed to be thread safe; additionally any modifications to the front cache are allowed only after the corresponding lock is acquired against the property.
Note: null values are not cached in the front cache and therefore this implementation is not optimized for caches that allow null values to be stored.

member.author: Alex Gleyzer, Gene Gleyzer 2002.09.10
Gene Gleyzer 2003.10.16
Ivan Cikic 2006.09.11

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICache
member.summary: An ICache is a dictionary that supports caching.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2004.01.05
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.07.11

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the dictionary previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.

member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.summary: Reset the cache statistics.

member.summary: Determine the total number of "get" operations since the cache statistics were last reset.

member.summary: Determine the total number of milliseconds spent on "get" operations since the cache statistics were last reset.
