member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per "get" invocation since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per "get" operation.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.TotalPuts
member.summary: Determine the total number of "put" operations since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.value: The total number of "put" operations.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.TotalPutsMillis
member.summary: Determine the total number of milliseconds spent on "put" operations since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.value: The total number of milliseconds processing "put" operations.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.AveragePutMillis
member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per "put" invocation since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per "put" operation.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CacheHits
member.summary: Determine the rough number of cache hits since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.remarks: A cache hit is a read operation invocation (i.e. "get") for which an entry exists in this cache.
member.value: The number of "get" calls that have been served by existing cache entries.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CacheHitsMillis
member.summary: Determine the total number of milliseconds (since that last statistics reset) for the "get" operations for which an entry existed in this cache.
member.value: The total number of milliseconds for the "get" operations that were hits.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.AverageHitMillis
member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per "get" invocation that is a hit.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per cache hit.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CacheMisses
member.summary: Determine the rough number of cache misses since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.remarks: A cache miss is a "get" invocation that does not have an entry in this cache.
member.value: The number of "get" calls that failed to find an existing cache entry because the requested key was not in the cache.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CacheMissesMillis
member.summary: Determine the total number of milliseconds (since that last statistics reset) for the "get" operations for which no entry existed in this cache.
member.value: The total number of milliseconds (since that last statistics reset) for the "get" operations that were misses.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.AverageMissMillis
member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per "get" invocation that is a miss.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per cache miss.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.HitProbability
member.summary: Determine the rough probability (0 <= p <= 1) that the next invocation will be a hit, based on the statistics collected since the last reset of the cache statistics.
member.value: The cache hit probability (0 <= p <= 1).

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CachePrunes
member.summary: Determine the rough number of cache pruning cycles since the cache statistics were last reset.
member.remarks: For the LocalCache implementation, this refers to the number of times that the prune() method is executed.
member.value: The total number of cache pruning cycles (since that last statistics reset).

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.CachePrunesMillis
member.summary: Determine the total number of milliseconds (since that last statistics reset) spent on cache pruning.
member.remarks: For the LocalCache implementation, this refers to the time spent in the prune() method.
member.value: The total number of milliseconds (since that last statistics reset) for cache pruning operations.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheStatistics.AveragePruneMillis
member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per cache pruning.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per cache pruning.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
Note: this implementation does not differentiate between missing keys or null values stored in the back dictionary; in both cases the returned dictionary will not contain the corresponding entry.

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.summary: Helper method used by and to perform common maintanence tasks after completing an operation against the back.
member.reamarks: This includes removing the keys from the control cache, and evaluating if it is safe to update the front with the "new" value. The implementation makes use of the following assumption: if listEvents == IGNORE_LIST then key does not exist in the front, and there is no key based listener for it. Any key passed to this method must be locked in the control cache by the caller.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCache.CacheMisses

member.remarks: A cache miss is a "get" invocation that does not have an entry in this cache.
member.value: The number of "get" calls that failed to find an existing cache entry because the requested key was not in the cache.

member.value: The average number of milliseconds per cache miss.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCache.HitProbability
member.summary: Determine the rough probability (0 <= p <= 1) that the next invocation will be a hit, based on the statistics collected since the last reset of the cache statistics.
member.value: The cache hit probability (0 <= p <= 1).

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.CacheListenerSupport.ISynchronousListener
member.summary: A tag interface indicating that tagged implementation has to receive the notifications in a synchronous manner.

remarks.p: Consider an ICacheListener that subscribes to receive notifications for distributed (partitioned) cache. All events notifications are received by the service thread and immediately queued to be processed by the dedicated event dispatcher thread. This makes it impossible to differentiate between the event caused by the updates made by this thread and any other thread. Forcing the events to be processed on the service thread guarantees that by the time "put" or "remove" requests return to the caller all relevant cache event notification have been processed (due to the "in order delivery" rule enforced by the TCMP).

This interface should be considered as a very advanced feature, so an ICacheListener implementation that is tagged as an ISynchronousListener must exercise extreme caution during event processing since any delay with return or unhandled exception will cause a delay or complete shutdown of the corresponding cache service.

Note: The contract by the event producer in respect to the ISynchronousListener is somewhat weaker then the general one. First, the ISynchronousListener implementaion should make no assumptions about the event source obtained by .
Second, in the event of [automatic] service restart, the listener has to be re-registered manually.
Third, and the most important, no calls against the are allowed during the synchronous event processing (the only exception being a call to remove the listener itself).

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.ISynchronousListener
member.summary: A tag interface indicating that a listener implementation has to receive the event notifications synchronously on the corresponding service's thread.
member.remarks: This interface should be considered as a very advanced feature, as a listener implementation that is marked as a SynchronousListener must exercise extreme caution during event processing since any delay with return or unhandled exception will cause a delay or complete shutdown of the corresponding service.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType
member.summary: Type of CompositeCache invalidation strategy.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType.ListenNone
member.summary: No invalidation strategy.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType.ListenPresent
member.summary: Invalidation strategy that instructs the CompositeCache to listen to the back dictionary events related only to the items currently present in the front dictionary.
member.remarks: This strategy serves best when the changes to the back dictionary come mostly from the CompositeCache itself.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType.ListenAll
member.summary: Invalidation strategy that instructs the CompositeCache to listen to all back dictionary events.
member.remarks: This strategy is preferred when updates to the back dictionary are frequent and with high probability come from the outside of this CompositeCache; for example multiple CompositeCache instances using the same back dictionary with a large degree of key set overlap between front dictionaries.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType.ListenAuto
member.summary: Invalidation strategy that instructs the CompositeCache implementation to switch automatically between ListenPresent and ListenAll strategies based on the cache statistics.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Cache.CompositeCacheStrategyType.ListenLogical
member.summary: Invalidation strategy that instructs the CompositeCache to listen to all back map events that are not synthetic . A synthetic event could be emitted as a result of eviction or expiration. With this invalidation stategy, it is possible for the front map to contain cache entries that have been synthetically removed from the back (though any subsequent re-insertion will cause the corresponding entries in the front map to be invalidated).

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ConditionalIndex
member.summary: ConditionalIndex is an implementation that uses an associated filter to evaluate whether or not an entry should be indexed. An entry's extracted value is only added to the index if the filter evaluates to true.
member.author: Tom Beerbower 2010.02.08
Jason Howes 2010.10.01

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.SimpleCacheIndex
member.summary: SimpleCacheIndex is an implementation used to correlate property values extracted from resource cache entries with corresponding keys using what is commonly known as an Inverted Index algorithm..

Jason Howes 2010.09.28

member.summary: Determine if indexed information for any entry in the indexed ICache has been excluded from this index. This information is used by implementations to determine the most optimal way to apply the index.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheIndex.IndexContents
member.summary: Get the IDictionary that contains the index contents.

remarks.p: The keys of the IDictionary are the return values from the IValueExtractor operating against the indexed ICache's values, and for each key, the corresponding value stored in the IDictionary is an ICollection of keys to the indexed value.

If the ICacheIndex is known to be ordered, then the returned IDictionary object will be an instance of SortedList (or wrapper thereof). The SortedList may or may not have an IComparer object associated with it.
A client should assume that the returned IDictionary object is read-only and must not attempt to modify it.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeySetBasedCache
member.summary: AbstractKeySetBasedCache is an extension to the that has a full awareness of the set of keys upon which the cache is based.

remarks.p: As a result, it is possible to optimize the implementation of a number of methods that benefit from a knowledge of the entire set of keys.

Read-only implementations must implement and . Read/write implementations must additionally implement and . If the implementation has any cost of returning an "old value", then the and
methods should also be implemented. The only other obvious method for optimization is , if the implementation is able to do it in bulk.

member.author: Cameron Purdy 2005.09.20
Ana Cikic 2006.11.27

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache
member.summary: AbstractKeyBasedCache is a base class for implementations.

remarks.p: AbstractKeyBasedCache requires a read-only sub-type to implement only and methods, and a read-write sub-type to additionally implement only and .

A number of the methods have implementations provided, but are extremely inefficient for caches that contain large amounts of data, including , and . Furthermore, if any of a number of method implementations has any cost of returning an "old value", then the and methods should also be implemented.

member.author: Cameron Purdy 2005.07.13

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.
member.remarks: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: An IDictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.InsertAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Copies all of the mappings from the specified IDictionary to this cache.
member.remarks: The effect of this call is equivalent to that of calling on this cache once for each mapping in the passed dictionary. The behavior of this operation is unspecified if the passed dictionary is modified while the operation is in progress.
member.param: The IDictionary containing the key/value pairings to insert into this cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the mapping for this key from this cache if present.
member.remarks: Expensive: updates both the underlying cache and the local cache.
member.param: Key whose mapping is to be removed from the cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the specified object with this cache for equality.
member.remarks: Returns true if the given object is also a cache and the two caches represent the same mappings. More formally, two caches t1 and t2 represent the same mappings if t1.Keys.Equals(t2.Keys) and for every key k in t1.Keys, (t1[k]==null ? t2[k]==null : t1[k].Equals(t2[k]) . This ensures that the Equals method works properly across different implementations of the cache interface.
member.param: Object to be compared for equality with this cache.
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to this cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code value for this cache.
member.remarks: The hash code of a cache is defined to be the sum of the hash codes of each entry in the cache's Entries. This ensures that t1.Equals(t2) implies that t1.GetHashCode()==t2.GetHashCode() for any two caches t1 and t2, as required by the general contract of object.GetHashCode.
member.returns: The hash code value for this cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.AbstractKeyBasedCache.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this cache.
member.remarks: The string representation consists of a list of key-value mappings in the order returned by the cache's Entries enumerator, enclosed in braces ("{}"). Adjacent mappings are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). Each key-value mapping is rendered as the key followed by an equals sign ("=") followed by the associated value. Keys and values are converted to strings as by object.ToString().
member.returns: A string representation of this cache.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.INamedCache
member.summary: An INamedCache is an that adds lifecycle management, event support, concurrency control, the ability to query cache content, and entry-targeted processing and aggregating operations.
member.remarks: Cached resources are expected to be managed in memory, and are typically composed of data that are stored persistently in a database, or data that have been assembled or calculated at some significant cost, thus these resources are referred to as cached.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2002.03.27
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.07.11

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IObservableCache
member.summary: The IObservableCache interface represents an object with a model being an that allows for pluggable notifications for occuring changes.

remarks.p: This is primarily intended for caches that have automatic pruning and purging strategies or caches that are asynchronously modified by different threads.

member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2002.02.11
Cameron Purdy 2003.05.21
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.07.11

method.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IConcurrentCache
member.summary: with additional concurrency features.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2001.12.16
Aleksandar Seovic 2006.07.12

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IConcurrentCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire cache to be locked. If the cache is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Pass the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IConcurrentCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IConcurrentCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.param: The object representing the criteria that the entries of this cache should satisfy.
The IComparable object which imposes an ordering on entries in the resulting collection; or null if the entries' values natural ordering should be used.

member.summary: Add an index to this IQueryCache.

member.param: The object that is used to extract an indexable object from a value stored in the indexed cache. Must not be null.
true if the contents of the indexed information should be ordered; false otherwise.
The IComparer object which imposes an ordering on entries in the indexed cache; or null if the entries' values natural ordering should be used.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IInvocableCache
member.summary: An IInvocableCache is an against which both entry-targeted processing and aggregating operations can be invoked.

remarks.p: While a traditional model for working with a dictionary is to have an operation access and mutate the dictionary directly through its API, the IInvocableCache allows that model of operation to be inverted such that the operations against the cache contents are executed by (and thus within the localized context of) a cache. This is particularly useful in a distributed environment, because it enables the processing to be moved to the location at which the entries-to-be-processed are being managed, thus providing efficiency by localization of processing.

member.author: Cameron Purdy, Gene Gleyzer, Jason Howes 2005.07.19
Aleksandar Seovic 2007.07.12

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IInvocableCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.INamedCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

Caches should be released by the same mechansim in which they were obtained. For example:
new Cache() - cache.Release()
CacheFactory.GetCache() - CacheFactory.ReleaseCache()
ConfigurableCacheFactory.EnsureCache() - ConfigurableCacheFactory.ReleaseCache()
Except for the case where the application code expicitly allocated the cache, this method should not be called by application code.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.INamedCache.Destroy
member.summary: Release and destroy this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.

Caches should be destroyed by the same mechansim in which they were obtained. For example:
new Cache() - cache.Destroy()
CacheFactory.GetCache() - CacheFactory.DestroyCache()
ConfigurableCacheFactory.EnsureCache() - ConfigurableCacheFactory.DestroyCache()
Except for the case where the application code expicitly allocated the cache, this method should not be called by application code.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.#ctor(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache,Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener)
member.summary: Create a materialized view of an INamedCache using an IFilter.
member.remarks: A materialized view is an implementation of Continuous Query exposed through the standard INamedCache API. This constructor allows a client to receive all events, including those that result from the initial population of the ContinuousQueryCache. In other words, all contents of the ContinuousQueryCache will be delivered to the listener as a sequence of events, including those items that already exist in the underlying (unfiltered) cache. Note that this constructor will always result in both the keys and values being cached locally if a listener is passed.
member.param: The INamedCache to create a view of.
The IFilter that defines the view.
An initial that will receive all the events from the ContinuousQueryCache, including those corresponding to its initial population.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire cache to be locked. If the cache is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Pass the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the dictionary previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ContinuousQueryCache.OnMemberJoined(System.Object,Tangosol.Net.MemberEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an has joined the service.

remarks.p: Note: this event could be called during the service restart on the local node in which case the listener's code should not attempt to use any clustered cache or service functionality.

The most critical situation arises when a number of threads are waiting for a local service restart, being blocked by a IService object synchronization monitor. Since the Joined event should be fired only once, it is called on a client thread while holding a synchronization monitor. An attempt to use other clustered service functionality during this local event notification may result in a deadlock.

member.param: that raised an event.
An event which indicates that membership has changed.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon
member.summary: This class is used to create and manage a daemon thread.
member.remarks:
A caller may use the following methods to control the Daemon object:
creates and starts the daemon thread
determines whether the daemon is running
stops the daemon thread and releases the related resources
Advanced options available to a designer or caller include:
before starting the daemon, a Thread priority can be provided
before starting the daemon, a Thread name can be provided
the actual Thread object can be accessed via this property
if the start method fails to start the daemon, the StartException property provides the failure information
The daemon thread itself executes the following events while it is running:
invoked when the daemon starts
invoked to wait for notification
invoked when a notification occurs
invoked when the thread is interrupted when waiting for a notification
invoked when an exception occurs while invoking one of the daemon events
invoked before the daemon exits
member.author: Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.23

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for Daemon object.
member.remarks: It sets to .

member.summary: Parametrized constructor.
member.param: If true, would be set to .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Finalize
member.summary: Perform clean up before object is reclaimed by GC.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.OnEnter
member.summary: Event notification called once the daemon's thread starts and before the daemon thread goes into the "wait - perform" loop.
member.remarks:
Unlike the OnInit() event, this method executes on the daemon's thread.
This method is called while the caller's thread is still waiting for a notification to "unblock" itself.
Any exception thrown by this method will terminate the thread immediately.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.OnException(System.Exception)
member.summary: This event occurs when an exception is thrown from OnEnter, OnWait, OnNotify and OnExit.
member.param: Exception that has occured.

member.summary: Event notification called right before the daemon thread terminates.
member.remarks: This method is guaranteed to be called only once and on the daemon's thread.

member.summary: Initialization method.

member.summary: Event notification called if the daemon's thread get interrupted.

member.summary: Event notification to perform a regular daemon activity.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Start
member.summary: Starts the daemon thread.
member.remarks: If the thread is already starting or has started, invoking this method has no effect. Synchronization is used here to verify that the start of the thread occurs; the lock is obtained before the thread is started, and the daemon thread notifies back that it has started from the Run() method.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Stop
member.summary: Stops the daemon thread associated with this object.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Run
member.summary: This method is called right after this daemon's thread starts.

member.summary: Causes the current thread to sleep for the specified interval.
member.remarks: If interrupted while sleeping the interrupt flag will be set and sleep will return false.
member.returns: true if the thread slept, or false if its sleep was interrupted.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.DaemonState
member.summary: Specifies the state of the daemon (Initial, Starting, Running, Exiting, Exited).
member.remarks:
Change the daemon's state to the specified state iff the new state is greater then the current state.
Despite this property being volatile, the setter is synchronized to ensure forward only state transitions. Additionally this allows for queries of the state to be held stable by synchronizing before the get and the corresponding usage. State transitions also trigger a notifyAll on the daemon's monitor
member.value: One of the values.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Lock
member.summary: An object that serves as a mutex for this Daemon synchronization.
member.remarks: When idle, the Daemon is waiting for a notification on the Lock object.
member.value: An object that serves as a mutex for this Deamon synchronization.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.Priority
member.summary: A non-zero value specifies the priority of the daemon's thread.
member.remarks: A zero value implies the Thread default priority. Priority must be set before the Daemon is started (by the Start() method) in order to have effect.
member.value: ThreadPriority value.

member.summary: The exception (if any) that prevented the daemon from starting successfully.
member.value: The exception that prevented the daemon from starting successfully.

member.summary: Date/time value that this Daemon's thread has started.
member.value: Date/time value that this Daemon's thread has started.

member.summary: The daemon thread if it is running, or null before the daemon starts and after the daemon stops.
member.value: The daemon thread if it is running, or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.ThreadName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the daemon thread.
member.remarks: If not specified, the type name will be used. This property can be set at design time or runtime. If set at runtime, it must be configured before Start() is invoked to cause the daemon thread to have the specified name.
member.value: The name of the daemon thread.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.WaitMillis
member.summary: The number of milliseconds that the daemon will wait for notification.
member.remarks: Zero means to wait indefinitely. Negative value means to skip waiting altogether.
member.value: The number of milliseconds that the daemon will wait for notification.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.IsNotification
member.summary: Specifes whether there is work for the daemon to do; if there is work, IsNotification must evaluate to true, and if there is no work (implying that the daemon should wait for work) then IsNotification must evaluate to false.
member.remarks:
To verify that a wait is necessary, the monitor on the Lock property is first obtained and then IsNotification is evaluated; only if IsNotification evaluates to false will the daemon go into a wait state on the Lock property.
To unblock (notify) the daemon, another thread should set IsNotification to true.
member.value: true if there is work for the daemon to do, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.IsAutoStart
member.summary: Determine whether this Daemon should start automatically at the initialization time.
member.value: true if Daemon should start automatically at the initialization time.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.IsExiting
member.summary: Specifies whether the daemon is instructed to stop.
member.value: true if Deamon is in the state Exiting; otherwise it false.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.Daemon.Daemon.IsStarted
member.summary: Specifies whether the daemon has been started.
member.value: true if Daemon is started; false if it is in the state of Initial or Exited.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IKeyAssociation
member.summary: A KeyAssociation represents a key object that has a natural association with another key object.
member.remarks:
The key object and the associated key may refer to entries in the same or different caches.
For example, the information provided by a key that implements IKeyAssociation may be used to place the key into the same partition as its associated key.
See for an example of a distributed query that takes advantage of a custom IKeyAssociation implementation to dramatically optimize its performance.

member.value: The host key that for this key object, or null if this key has no association.

remarks.p: In general, the method is called after the original CacheEventArgs is evaluated by an (such as ). The values contained by the returned CacheEventArgs object will be the ones given (sent) to the corresponding listener. Returning null will prevent the emission of the event altogether.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheTrigger
member.summary: ICacheTrigger represents a functional agent that allows to validate, reject or modify mutating operations against an underlying cache.

Ana Cikic 2008.07.02

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheTrigger.Process(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheTriggerEntry)
member.summary: This method is called before the result of a mutating operation represented by the specified entry object is committed into the underlying cache.
member.remarks:
An implementation of this method can evaluate the change by analyzing the original and the new value, and can perform any of the following:
override the requested change by setting to a different value;
undo the pending change by resetting the entry value to the original value obtained from
remove the entry from the underlying cache by calling
reject the pending change by throwing an , which will prevent any changes from being committed, and will result in the exception being thrown from the operation that attempted to modify the cache; or
do nothing, thus allowing the pending change to be committed to the underlying cache.
member.param: An object that represents the pending change to be committed to the cache, as well as the original state of the entry.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheTriggerEntry
member.summary: A entry represents a pending change to an entry that is about to committed to the underlying cache.
member.remarks: The methods inherited from provide both the pending state and the ability to alter that state. The original state of the entry can be obtained using the and properties.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IInvocableCacheEntry
member.summary: An IInvocableCacheEntry contains additional information and exposes additional operations that the basic ICacheEntry does not.
member.remarks: It allows non-existent entries to be represented, thus allowing their optional creation. It allows existent entries to be removed from the cache. It supports a number of optimizations that can ultimately be mapped through to indexes and other data structures of the underlying dictionary.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.IInvocableCacheEntry.SetValue(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Store the value corresponding to this entry.

remarks.p: If the entry does not exist, then the entry will be created by invoking this method, even with a null value (assuming the cache supports null values).
Unlike the property , this method does not return the previous value, and as a result may be significantly less expensive (in terms of cost of execution) for certain cache implementations.

member.param: The new value for this entry.
Pass true only if the insertion into or modification of the cache should be treated as a synthetic event.

member.returns: The extracted value.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache
member.summary: A local in-memory cache implementation.
member.remarks:
The implementation is thread safe and uses a combination of Most Recently Used (MRU) and Most Frequently Used (MFU) caching strategies.
The cache is size-limited, which means that once it reaches its maximum size ("high-water mark") it prunes itself (to its "low-water mark"). The cache high- and low-water-marks are measured in terms of "units", and each cached item by default uses one unit. All of the cache constructors, except for the default constructor, require the maximum number of units to be passed in. To change the number of units that each cache entry uses, either set the Units property of the cache entry, or extend the implementation so that the inner class calculates its own unit size. To determine the current, high-water and low-water sizes of the cache, use the cache object's , and properties. The HighUnits and LowUnits properties can be changed, even after the cache is in use. To specify the LowUnits value as a percentage when constructing the cache, use the extended constructor taking the percentage-prune-level.
Each cached entry never expires by default. To alter this behavior, use a constructor that takes the expiry-millis; for example, an expiry-millis value of 10000 will expire entries after 10 seconds. The property can also be set once the cache is in use, but it will not affect the expiry of previously cached items.
The cache can optionally be flushed on a periodic basis by setting the property or scheduling a specific flush time by setting the property.
Cache hit statistics can be obtained from the , and read-only properties. The statistics can be reset by invoking . The statistics are automatically reset when the cache is cleared (the method).
The LocalCache implements the interface, meaning it provides event notifications to any interested listener for each insert, update and delete, including those that occur when the cache is pruned or entries are automatically expired.
This implementation is designed to support extension through inheritence. To override the one-unit-per-entry default behavior, extend the inner Entry class and override the method.
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2001.04.19, 2005.05.18
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.11.13

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Collections.SynchronizedDictionary
member.summary: Synchronized IDictionary wrapper that uses read/write locks to synchronize access to the underlying dictionary.
member.remarks:
This class uses read/write locks to ensure that only a single thread can modify the underlying dictionary at any given time, while allowing concurrent reads by multiple threads.
While all individual operations exposed by this class are thread-safe, you may still need to synchronize access to an instance of this class if you need to perform multiple operations atomically.
In order to do that, you can do one of the following:
Lock the property. Because the write locks used internally also lock SyncRoot, this will prevent concurrent modification. However, concurrent read operations will still be allowed, which means that other threads will be able to see partial updates. If you need truly atomic multi-operation updates, you should use write locks instead.
Use read locks. By acquiring a read lock externally, you can ensure that no modifications take place while you are reading from the dictionary. See for details.
Use write locks. By acquiring a write lock, you can achieve complete isolation and fully atomic multi-operation updates, as no other thread will be able to either read from or write to the dictionary until the write lock is released. See for details.
Note 1: If you attempt to acquire a write lock on a thread that holds a read lock, the read lock will be promoted to a write lock as soon as all read locks held by other threads are released.
Note 2: The enumerator returned by the method is not thread-safe. You should either acquire a read lock or lock the explicitly if you need to enumerate dictionary entries in a thread-safe manner.
Note 3: This class has been renamed from SynchronizedHashtable to SynchronizedDictionary in Coherence 3.5, to better reflect the fact that it can be used to wrap any IDictionary implementation.
member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.11.13
Aleksandar Seovic 2009.08.03

member.summary: Get an object that can be used to synchronize access to this dictionary.

You can use it externally to block mutating operations as well, but keep in mind that simply locking this property will not prevent concurrent read operations. If you need to block both read and write operations, use method instead.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Load(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates to the cache that the specified key should be loaded into the cache, if it is not already in the cache.
member.remarks:
This provides a means to "pre-load" a single entry into the cache using the cache's loader.
If a valid entry with the specified key already exists in the cache, or if the cache does not have a loader, then this method has no effect.
An implementation may perform the load operation asynchronously.
member.param: The key to request to be loaded.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.LoadAll
member.summary: Indicates to the cache that it should load data from its loader to fill the cache; this is sometimes referred to as "pre-loading" or "warming" a cache.
member.remarks:
The specific set of data that will be loaded is unspecified. The implementation may choose to load all data, some specific subset of the data, or no data. An implementation may require that the loader implement the IIterableCacheLoader interface in order for this method to load any data.
An implementation may perform the load operation asynchronously.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the dictionary previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.summary: Factory pattern.
member.returns: A new instance of the Lock class (or a subclass thereof).

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire cache to be locked. If the cache is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Pass the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry
member.summary: A holder for a cached value.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry.SetValue(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Store the value corresponding to this entry.

remarks.p: If the entry does not exist, then the entry will be created by invoking this method, even with a null value (assuming the cache supports null values).
Unlike the property , this method does not return the previous value, and as a result may be significantly less expensive (in terms of cost of execution) for certain cache implementations.

member.param: The new value for this entry.
Pass true only if the insertion into or modification of the cache should be treated as a synthetic event.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry.Extract(Tangosol.Util.IValueExtractor)
member.summary: Extract a value out of the entry's value.
member.remarks: Calling this method is semantically equivalent to extractor.Extract(entry.Value), but this method may be significantly less expensive because the resultant value may be obtained from a forward index, for example.
member.param: An to apply to the entry's value
member.returns: The extracted value.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry.Update(Tangosol.Util.IValueUpdater,System.Object)
member.summary: Update the entry's value.
member.param: An used to modify the entry's value.
Value to update target object to.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry.Remove(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove this entry from the cache if it is present in the cache.

remarks.p: This method supports both the operation corresponding to IDictionary.Remove as well as synthetic operations such as eviction. If the containing cache does not differentiate between the two, then this method will always be identical to IInvocableCache.Remove(Key).

member.param: Pass true only if the removal from the dictionary should be treated as a synthetic event.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.LocalCache.Entry.ResetTouchCount
member.summary: Reset the number of times that the cache entry has been touched.
member.remarks: The touch count does not get reset to zero, but rather to a fraction of its former self; this prevents long lived items from gaining an unasailable advantage in the eviction process.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache
member.summary: A "near cache" is a whose front cache is a size-limited and/or auto-expiring local cache, and whose back cache is a distributed cache.
member.remarks: A CompositeCache is a cache that has a "front" cache and a "back" cache; the front cache is assumed to be low latency but incomplete, and the back cache is assumed to be complete but high latency.

Gene Gleyzer 2003.10.16
Ivan Cikic 2006.11.13

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.Destroy
member.summary: Release and destroy this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire cache to be locked. If the cache is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Pass the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock.
Expensive: Locking always occurs on the back cache.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks:
This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
Expensive: Locking always occurs on the back cache.
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.summary: Return a collection of the values contained in this cache for entries that satisfy the criteria expressed by the filter.
member.remarks:
It is guaranteed that enumerator will traverse the array in such a way that the values come up in ascending order, sorted by the specified comparer or according to the natural ordering.
The operation always executes against the back cache.
member.param: The object representing the criteria that the entries of this cache should satisfy.
The IComparable object which imposes an ordering on entries in the resulting collection; or null if the entries' values natural ordering should be used.
member.returns: A collection of entries that satisfy the specified criteria.

member.summary: Add an index to this IQueryCache.
member.remarks:
This allows to correlate values stored in this indexed cache (or attributes of those values) to the corresponding keys in the indexed cache and increase the performance of GetKeys and GetEntries methods.
The operation always executes against the back cache.
member.param: The object that is used to extract an indexable object from a value stored in the indexed cache. Must not be null.
true if the contents of the indexed information should be ordered; false otherwise.
The IComparer object which imposes an ordering on entries in the indexed cache; or null if the entries' values natural ordering should be used.

member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entry specified by the passed key, returning the result of the invocation.
member.remarks: The operation always executes against the back cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.InvokeAll(System.Collections.ICollection,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entries specified by the passed keys, returning the result of the invocation for each.
member.remarks: The operation always executes against the back cache.
member.param: The keys to process; these keys are not required to exist within the cache.
The IEntryProcessor to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A cache containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against each of the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .
The operation always executes against the back cache.

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A cache containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.NearCache.OnMemberJoined(System.Object,Tangosol.Net.MemberEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an has joined the service.

remarks.p: The most critical situation arises when a number of threads are waiting for a local service restart, being blocked by a IService object synchronization monitor. Since the Joined event should be fired only once, it is called on a client thread while holding a synchronization monitor. An attempt to use other clustered service functionality during this local event notification may result in a deadlock.

member.param: that raised an event.
An event which indicates that membership has changed.

member.summary: Determine the average number of milliseconds per "get" invocation that is a miss.
member.value: The average number of milliseconds per cache miss.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Cache.Support.WindowsFormsCacheListener
member.summary: Ensures that any event handling code that needs to run as a response to a cache event is executed on the UI thread.
member.remarks:
The crucial limiting factor when updating UI elements from a background thread is the thread affinity Windows Forms controls and forms have to the underlying thread that created them.
All Windows messages are actually messages between threads, and each thread has its own message queue. Each and every thread message can only be processed on the thread it belongs to. When a thread creates a window, that window's messages are actually messages destined for the message queue of the creating thread. Consequently, all windows (such as forms and controls) can only process messages on the thread that created them. Method calls on forms and controls often result internally with posting of at least one such message.
This class allows end users to ignore this fact and handle Coherence cache events, which are always raised from a background thread, as if they were raised within the UI thread. This class will ensure that the call is properly marshalled and executed on the UI thread.
member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.11.01

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.InsertAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Copies all of the mappings from the specified dictionary to this cache (optional operation).
member.remarks: These mappings will replace any mappings that this cache had for any of the keys currently in the specified dictionary.
member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through cache items.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object that can be used to iterate through cache items.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Destroy
member.summary: Release and destroy this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Truncate
member.summary: Removes all mappings from this instance of INamedCache.
member.remarks: Note: the removal of entries caused by this truncate operation will not be observable.

method.

method.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire map to be locked. If the map is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Passing the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock is not allowed for WrapperNamedCache and will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

remarks.p: It is guaranteed that enumerator will traverse the array in such a way that the entry values come up in ascending order, sorted by the specified comparer or according to the natural ordering.

member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entry specified by the passed key, returning the result of the invocation.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.InvokeAll(System.Collections.ICollection,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entries specified by the passed keys, returning the result of the invocation for each.
member.param: The keys to process; these keys are not required to exist within the cache.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Cache.WrapperNamedCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.ConfigurableAddressProvider
member.summary:
ConfigurableAddressProvider is an implementation of the interface based on a static list of addresses configured in an XML element that contains one or more items in the following format:
<socket-address> <address>...</address> <port>...</port> </socket-address>
member.remarks: The order of items in the configured list will be randomized to provide basic load balancing. This implementation is not thread safe.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2008.08.18
Ana Cikic 2008.08.22

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.IConfigurableCacheFactory.ReleaseCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release local resources associated with the specified instance of the cache.
member.remarks:
This invalidates a reference obtained from the factory.
Releasing an reference makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the content of the cache. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be released.

member.summary: Releases and destroys the specified .
member.remarks: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be destroyed.

member.remarks:
This invalidates a reference obtained from the factory.
Releasing an reference makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the content of the cache. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.DefaultConfigurableCacheFactory.DestroyCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release and destroy the specified cache.
member.remarks: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.
member.param: The INamedCache object to be destroyed.

member.summary: Resolve the specified "XYZ-scheme" by retrieving the base element refered to by the "scheme-ref" element, resolving it recursively, and combining it with the specified overrides and cache specific attributes.
member.param: The cache configuration xml.
A scheme element to resolve.
The cache info (optional).
If true, the actual cache scheme is the only "xyz-scheme" child of the specified xmlScheme element; otherwise it's the xmlScheme element itself.
If true, the child scheme must be present; false otherwise.
If true, apply the specified overrides and cache-specific attributes to the base scheme element; otherwise return a reference to the base scheme element.
member.returns: A "scheme" element associated with a given cache name; null if the child is missing and is not required.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.ICacheService
member.summary: An ICacheService is a service providing a collection of named caches that hold resources.
member.remarks: These resources are expected to be managed in memory, and are typically composed of data that are also stored persistently in a database, or data that have been assembled or calculated at some significant cost, thus these resources are referred to as cached.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2002.02.08
Ana Cikic 2006.09.15
