Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.16

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.IControllable.Configure(Tangosol.Run.Xml.IXmlElement)
member.summary: Configure the controllable service.
member.remarks: This method can only be called before the controllable service is started.
member.param: An carrying configuration information specific to the IControllable object.
member.exception: Thrown if the service is already running.
Thrown if the configuration information is invalid.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.IControllable.Start
member.summary: Start the controllable service.
member.remarks: This method should only be called once per the life cycle of the IControllable service. This method has no affect if the service is already running.
member.exception: Thrown if a service does not support being re-started, and the service was already started and subsequently stopped and then an attempt is made to start the service again; also thrown if the IControllable service has not been configured.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.IControllable.Shutdown
member.summary: Stop the controllable service.
member.remarks:
This is a controlled shut-down, and is preferred to the method.
This method should only be called once per the life cycle of the controllable service. Calling this method for a service that has already stopped has no effect.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.IControllable.Stop
member.summary: Hard-stop the controllable service.
member.remarks: Use for normal service termination. Calling this method for a service that has already stopped has no effect.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.IControllable.IsRunning
member.summary: Determine whether or not the controllable service is running.
member.remarks: Returns false before a service is started, while the service is starting, while a service is shutting down and after the service has stopped. It only returns true after completing its start processing and before beginning its shutdown processing.
member.returns: true if the service is running; false otherwise.

member.name: E:Tangosol.Net.IService.MemberJoined
member.summary: Invoked when an has joined the service.

remarks.p: Note: this event could be called during the service restart on in which case the event handler should not attempt to use any cache or service functionality.

The most critical situation arises when a number of threads are waiting for a local service restart, being blocked by a IService object synchronization monitor. Since the Joined event should be fired only once, it is called on a client thread while holding a synchronization monitor. An attempt to use other service functionality during this local event notification may result in a deadlock.

member.name: E:Tangosol.Net.IService.MemberLeaving
member.summary: Invoked when an is leaving the service.

member.name: E:Tangosol.Net.IService.MemberLeft
member.summary: Invoked when an has left the service.
member.remarks: Note: this event could be called during the service restart in which case the event handler should not attempt to use any cache or service functionality.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.ICacheService.EnsureCache(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain an interface that provides a view of cached resources.
member.remarks: The view is identified by name within this ICacheService. Typically, repeated calls to this method with the same view name will result in the same view reference being returned.
member.param: The name, within this ICacheService, that uniquely identifies a view; null is legal, and may imply a default name.
member.returns: An INamedCache interface which can be used to access the resources of the specified view.
member.exception: If the service is not running.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.ICacheService.ReleaseCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release local resources associated with the specified instance of the cache.

remarks.p: This invalidates a reference obtained by using the method.

Releasing a reference to a cache makes the cache reference no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.

member.param: The cache object to be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.ICacheService.DestroyCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release and destroy the specified cache.
member.remarks: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.
member.param: The cache object to be released.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.ICacheService.CacheNames
member.summary: A collection of string objects, one for each cache name that has been previously registered with this ICacheService.
member.value: ICollection of cache names.
member.exception: If the service is not running or has stopped.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Internal.ScopedReferenceStore
member.summary: ScopedReferenceStore holds scoped cache or service references.
member.remarks:
Cache references are scoped by name and, optionally, by Principal. Service references are scoped by name and, optionally, by Principal. Principal scoping is handled automatically; ScopedReferenceStore requires no explicit input about Principals from its clients. Principal scoping is configured in the operational configuration and applies only to remote caches and remote services.
An instance of ScopedReferenceStore must contain either cache references or service references, but not both simultaneously.
ScopedReferenceStore is not thread-safe unless a lock is obtained on the SyncRoot property; otherwise, multi-threaded clients must provide their own locking mechanism.
member.author: David Guy 2010.03.17

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage
member.summary: IMessage is the root interface for all message objects sent by peer endpoints through an .
member.remarks: IMessage objects are created by an . An IMessage object has a type identifier that uniquely identifies the IMessage object class and is scoped to the IMessageFactory that created the IMessage. In other words, IMessage objects with the same type identifier that were created by two different IMessageFactory instances may be of different classes, but IMessage objects with the same type identifier that were created by the same IMessageFactory are guaranteed to be of the same type.
member.author: Jason Howes 2006.04.04
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage.TypeId
member.summary: Return the identifier for this IMessage object's class.
member.remarks: The type identifier is scoped to the IMessageFactory that created this IMessage.
member.value: An identifier that uniquely identifies this IMessage object's class.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets the IChannel through which the IMessage will be sent, was sent, or was received.
member.value: The IChannel through which the IMessage will be sent, was sent, or was received.
member.exception: If the IChannel has already been set.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage.ExecuteInOrder
member.summary: Determine if this IMessage should be executed in the same order as it was received relative to other messages sent through the same IChannel.

remarks.p: Consider two messages: M1 and M2. Say M1 is received before M2 but executed on a different execute thread (for example, when the is configured with an execute thread pool of size greater than 1). In this case, there is no way to guarantee that M1 will finish executing before M2. However, if M1 returns true from this method, the IConnectionManager will execute M1 on its service thread, thus guaranteeing that M1 will execute before M2.

In-order execution should be considered as a very advanced feature and implementations that return true from this method must exercise extreme caution during execution, since any delay or unhandled exceptions will cause a delay or complete shutdown of the underlying IConnectionManager.

member.returns: true if the IMessage should be executed in the same order as it was received relative to other messages.

member.author: Ana Cikic 2006.08.21

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IStatus
member.summary: An IStatus represents an asynchronous sent to a peer.
member.remarks:
The status of the IRequest can be determined by checking the value of the property. If it returns false, the request is still in progress. A return value of true indicates that the request has either completed successfully, completed unsuccessfully, or has been canceled.
When the IRequest completes, the sent by the peer can be retrieved from the property. If this property value is null, the IRequest was explicitly canceled ().
Rather than constantly polling the IRequest for the outcome of the IRequest, a thread can alternatively use the IStatus to wait for the IRequest to complete.
member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.23
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.author: Ana Cikic 2006.08.21

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IProtocol
member.summary: An IProtocol is a binding between a unique name, version information, and a set of types.

remarks.p: It is used to describe the types of objects (the "dialect", so to speak) that can be exchanged between two endpoints through an via a .

Before an IConnection can be created or accepted, one or more IProtocol instances must be registered with the client and server-side . During IConnection establishment, the client's sends information about each registered IProtocol. A compatable set of IProtocol objects (or superset) must be registered with server's IConnectionManager in order for the the IConnection to be accepted.

member.author: Jason Howes 2006.04.11
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.summary: IResponse is the root interface for all response messages sent by peer endpoints through an .

remarks.p:
IResponse objects are created by an and are associated with a corresponding . The status of the IResponse may be determined by reading the property value:
if false, the IRequest was successfully processed by the receiver and the IResponse object contains a valid result
if true, an exception occured while processing the IRequest

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.IInvocationService
member.summary: The IInvocationService is an for delivering executable objects to a remote cluster member for invocation.
member.remarks: The executable objects must implement the interface. Using this interface, application code can execute an IInvocable object within the context of a remote cluster.
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2003.01.05
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.09.01

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.IInvocationService.Query(Tangosol.Net.IInvocable,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Synchronously invoke the specified task on the cluster member to which the client is connected.
member.remarks: This method will not return until the cluster member has completed its processing, failed in its processing, or died trying.
member.param: The IInvocable object to send to the cluster member in order to be invoked on that member.
Parameter reserved for future use. Must be null.
member.returns: An IDictionary of the result of the invocation, keyed by the "local" object.

Goran Milosavljevic 2006.09.01

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.ClusterName
member.summary: The name of the cluster with which this member is associated.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.SiteName
member.summary: Determine the configured name for the site (such as a data center) in which this IMember resides.
member.remarks: This name is used for logging purposes and to differentiate among multiple geographic sites.
member.returns: The configured site name or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.RackName
member.summary: Determine the configured name for the rack (such as a physical rack, cage or blade frame) in which this IMember resides.
member.remarks: This name is used for logging purposes and to differentiate among multiple racks within a particular data center, for example.
member.value: The configured rack name or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.MachineName
member.summary: Determine the configured name for the machine (such as a host name) in which this IMember resides.
member.remarks: This name is used for logging purposes and to differentiate among multiple servers, and may be used as the basis for determining the MachineId property.
member.value: The configured machine name or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.ProcessName
member.summary: Determine the configured name for the process (such as a JVM) in which this IMember resides.
member.remarks: This name is used for logging purposes and to differentiate among multiple processes on a a single machine.
member.value: The configured process name or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.MemberName
member.summary: Determine the configured name for the IMember.
member.remarks: This name is used for logging purposes and to differentiate among members running within a particular process.
member.value: The configured IMember name or null.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.IMember.RoleName
member.summary: Determine the configured role name for the IMember.
member.remarks: This role is completely definable by the application, and can be used to determine what members to use for specific purposes, such as to send particular types of work to.
member.value: The configured role name for the IMember or null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

To unregister the ICacheListener, use the
method.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.AddCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,Tangosol.Util.IFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a cache listener that receives events based on a filter evaluation.

remarks.p: The listeners will receive objects, but if is passed as true, they might not contain the OldValue and NewValue properties.

To unregister the , use the
method.

member.param: The to add.

A filter that will be passed CacheEventArgs objects to select from; a CacheEventArgs will be delivered to the listener only if the filter evaluates to true for that CacheEventArgs; null is equivalent to a filter that alway returns true.
true to indicate that the objects do not have to include the OldValue and NewValue property values in order to allow optimizations.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.RemoveCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,Tangosol.Util.IFilter)
member.summary: Remove a cache listener that previously signed up for events based on a filter evaluation.
member.param: The to remove.
A filter used to evaluate events; null is equivalent to a filter that alway returns true.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the dictionary previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.InsertAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Copies all of the mappings from the specified dictionary to this cache (optional operation).
member.remarks: These mappings will replace any mappings that this cache had for any of the keys currently in the specified dictionary.
member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire cache to be locked. If the cache is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Pass the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.LocalNamedCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteCacheService.ReleaseCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release local resources associated with the specified instance of the cache.

remarks.p: This invalidates a reference obtained by using the method.

Releasing a reference to a cache makes the cache reference no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.

member.param: The cache object to be released.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteInvocationService.Query(Tangosol.Net.IInvocable,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Synchronously invoke the specified task on each of the specified members.

remarks.p: This method will not return until the specified members have completed their processing, failed in their processing, or died trying.
IMembers that are specified but are not currently running the IInvocationService will not invoke the specified object.

IMembers that leave (gracefully or otherwise) before the invocation completes will not register a result, and the amount of processing that completed is indeterminate. IMembers that encounter an exception during invocation will not be retried; whatever result has been registered by that point by that member for that IInvocable object will be returned. Specifically, the result for a given member will be null under the following conditions:

list.item: if the member did not exist
if the member was not running the service at the time that the query method was invoked
if the member left (via the shutdown or stop methods, or unexpectedly) before responding
if the member encountered an exception while processing and had not registered a non-null result
if the member completed successfully but registered no result
if the member completed successfully but explicitly registered a result of null

member.param: The IInvocable object to distribute to the specified members in order to be invoked on those members.
Optional collection of cluster members to which the IInvocable object will be distributed; if null, the IInvocable object will be distributed to all cluster members that are running this service.
member.returns: An IDictionary of result objects keyed by object.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver
member.summary: An IReceiver processes unsolicited objects sent via any number of objects.

remarks.p: An IReceiver acts as a server-side proxy, in that it can be registered with an , it can be looked up, and IChannels from multiple clients can be established to it. In this sense, the IReceiver represents server-side state shared across any number of client IChannels, and thus provides an efficient mechanism for demultiplexing multi-client communication into a shared service proxy, and locating state that is shared across all of those client IChannels. Conversely, the IChannel object represents client-specific state, allowing per-client information to be efficiently managed on the server side.

While the IReceiver is particularly useful as a server-side proxy, it is also useful on the client, allowing a client to publish named services to a server, and in the case of both named services and any other IChannels created by a client, it allows a client to efficiently manage stateful communication and process unsolicited IMessage objects.

member.author: Cameron Purdy/Jason Howes 2005.04.17
Ana Cikic 2006.08.15

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver.RegisterChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel)
member.summary: Notify this IReceiver that it has been associated with a IChannel.

remarks.p: This method is invoked by the IChannel when an IReceiver is associated with the IChannel.

Once registered, the IReceiver will receive all unsolicited IMessage objects sent through the IChannel until the IChannel is unregistered or closed. Without a IReceiver, the unsolicited IMessage objects are executed with only an IChannel as context; with an IReceiver, the IReceiver is given the IMessage to process, and may execute the IMessage in turn.

member.param: An IChannel that has been associated with this IReceiver.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver.OnMessage(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage)
member.summary: Called when an unsolicited (non-Response) IMessage is received by an IChannel that had been previously registered with this IReceiver.
member.param: An unsolicited IMessage received by a registered IChannel.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver.UnregisterChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel)
member.summary: Unregister the given IChannel with this IReceiver.

remarks.p: This method is invoked by the IChannel when an IReceiver is disassociated with the IChannel.
Once unregistered, the IReceiver will no longer receive unsolicited IMessage objects sent through the IChannel.

member.param: An IChannel that was disassociated with this IReceiver.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver.Name
member.summary: The name of this IReceiver.
member.remarks: If the IReceiver is registered with a , the registration and any subsequent accesses are by the IReceiver's name, meaning that the name must be unique within the domain of the IConnectionManager.
member.value: The IReceiver name.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver.Protocol
member.summary: The understood by the IReceiver.
member.remarks: Only IChannel objects with the specified IProtocol can be registered with this IReceiver.
member.value: The IProtocol used by this IReceiver.

member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.Invoke(System.Object,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entry specified by the passed key, returning the result of the invocation.
member.param: The key to process; it is not required to exist within the cache.
The IEntryProcessor to use to process the specified key.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.InvokeAll(System.Collections.ICollection,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entries specified by the passed keys, returning the result of the invocation for each.
member.param: The keys to process; these keys are not required to exist within the cache.
The IEntryProcessor to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against each of the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.
member.exception: If is passed as key parameter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.
member.exception: If is passed as key parameter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire map to be locked. If the map is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Passing the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock is not allowed for SafeNamedCache and will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.
member.exception: If is passed as key parameter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.UnregisterChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel)
member.summary: Unregister the given IChannel with this IReceiver.

remarks.p: This method is invoked by the IChannel when an IReceiver is disassociated with the IChannel.
Once unregistered, the IReceiver will no longer receive unsolicited IMessage objects sent through the IChannel.

member.param: An IChannel that was disassociated with this IReceiver.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.RegisterChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel)
member.summary: Notify this IReceiver that it has been associated with a IChannel.

remarks.p: This method is invoked by the IChannel when an IReceiver is associated with the IChannel.

Once registered, the IReceiver will receive all unsolicited IMessage objects sent through the IChannel until the IChannel is unregistered or closed. Without a IReceiver, the unsolicited IMessage objects are executed with only an IChannel as context; with an IReceiver, the IReceiver is given the IMessage to process, and may execute the IMessage in turn.

member.param: An IChannel that has been associated with this IReceiver.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.OnMessage(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IMessage)
member.summary: Called when an unsolicited (non-Response) IMessage is received by an IChannel that had been previously registered with this IReceiver.
member.param: An unsolicited IMessage received by a registered IChannel.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Destroy
member.summary: Release and destroy this instance of .

remarks.p: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire map to be locked. If the map is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Passing the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock is not allowed for SafeNamedCache and will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.param: Key being locked.
The number of milliseconds to continue trying to obtain a lock; pass zero to return immediately; pass -1 to block the calling thread until the lock could be obtained.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entry specified by the passed key, returning the result of the invocation.
member.param: The key to process; it is not required to exist within the cache.
The IEntryProcessor to use to process the specified key.
member.returns: The result of the invocation as returned from the IEntryProcessor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.RemoteNamedCache.BinaryNamedCache.InvokeAll(System.Collections.ICollection,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entries specified by the passed keys, returning the result of the invocation for each.
member.param: The keys to process; these keys are not required to exist within the cache.
The IEntryProcessor to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against each of the specified keys.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeService
member.summary: Base class for remote services safe-wrapping.
member.remarks: These "Safe" wrappers are responsible for ensuring that the wrapped component is always usable. For example, if the connection between the Coherence*Extend client and proxy service is ever severed, the messaging framework alerts the "Remote" service (via a ConnectionListener), and the "Remote" service transitions itself to a stopped state. During the next use of the "Remote" service (via the "Safe" wrapper), the "Safe" wrapper detects that the wrapped service has stopped and attempts to restart it.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Configure the controllable service.
member.remarks: This method can only be called before the controllable service is started.
member.param: An carrying configuration information specific to the IControllable object.
member.exception: Thrown if the service is already running.
Thrown if the configuration information is invalid.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeService.Start
member.summary: Start the controllable service.
member.remarks: This method should only be called once per the life cycle of the IControllable service. This method has no affect if the service is already running.
member.exception: Thrown if a service does not support being re-started, and the service was already started and subsequently stopped and then an attempt is made to start the service again; also thrown if the IControllable service has not been configured.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeService.Shutdown
member.summary: Stop the controllable service.
member.remarks:
This is a controlled shut-down, and is preferred to the method.
This method should only be called once per the life cycle of the controllable service. Calling this method for a service that has already stopped has no effect.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeService.Stop
member.summary: Hard-stop the controllable service.
member.remarks: Use for normal service termination. Calling this method for a service that has already stopped has no effect.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeService.OnMemberJoined(System.Object,Tangosol.Net.MemberEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an has joined the service.

remarks.p: Note: this event could be called during the service restart on the local node in which case the listener's code should not attempt to use any clustered cache or service functionality.

The most critical situation arises when a number of threads are waiting for a local service restart, being blocked by a IService object synchronization monitor. Since the Joined event should be fired only once, it is called on a client thread while holding a synchronization monitor. An attempt to use other clustered service functionality during this local event notification may result in a deadlock.

member.param: that raised an event.
An event which indicates that membership has changed.

member.summary: Obtain an interface that provides a view of resources shared among members of a cluster.
member.remarks: The view is identified by name within this ICacheService. Typically, repeated calls to this method with the same view name will result in the same view reference being returned.
member.param: The name, within this ICacheService, that uniquely identifies a view; null is legal, and may imply a default name.
member.returns: An INamedCache interface which can be used to access the resources of the specified view.
member.exception: If the service is not running.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeCacheService.ReleaseCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release local resources associated with the specified instance of the cache.

remarks.p: This invalidates a reference obtained by using the method.

Releasing a map reference to a cache makes the map reference no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference.
The reference that is released using this method can no longer be used; any attempt to use the reference will result in an exception.

member.param: The cache object to be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeCacheService.DestroyCache(Tangosol.Net.INamedCache)
member.summary: Release and destroy the specified cache.
member.remarks: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.
member.param: The cache object to be released.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeInvocationService
member.summary: "Safe" wrapper for Remote Invocation service.
member.author: Goran Milosavljevic 2006.11.08

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeInvocationService.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeInvocationService.Query(Tangosol.Net.IInvocable,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Synchronously invoke the specified task on each of the specified members.

remarks.p: This method will not return until the specified members have completed their processing, failed in their processing, or died trying.
IMembers that are specified but are not currently running the IInvocationService will not invoke the specified object.

IMembers that leave (gracefully or otherwise) before the invocation completes will not register a result, and the amount of processing that completed is indeterminate. IMembers that encounter an exception during invocation will not be retried; whatever result has been registered by that point by that member for that IInvocable object will be returned. Specifically, the result for a given member will be null under the following conditions:

list.item: if the member did not exist
if the member was not running the service at the time that the query method was invoked
if the member left (via the shutdown or stop methods, or unexpectedly) before responding
if the member encountered an exception while processing and had not registered a non-null result
if the member completed successfully but registered no result
if the member completed successfully but explicitly registered a result of null

member.param: The IInvocable object to distribute to the specified members in order to be invoked on those members.
Optional collection of cluster members to which the IInvocable object will be distributed; if null, the IInvocable object will be distributed to all cluster members that are running this service.
member.returns: An IDictionary of result objects keyed by object.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeInvocationService.EnsureRunningInvocationService(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the wrapped IInvocationService.
member.remarks: This method ensures that the returned IInvocationService is running before returning it. If the IInvocationService is not running and has not been explicitly stopped, the IInvocationService is restarted.
member.param: If true and the wrapped IInvocationService is restarted, the calling thread will be blocked until the wrapped IInvocationService event dispatcher queue is empty and all outstanding tasks have been executed.
member.returns: The running wrapped IInvocationService.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeInvocationService.RunningInvocationService
member.summary: Calculated property that returns the running wrapped IInvocationService.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.InsertAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Copies all of the mappings from the specified dictionary to this cache (optional operation).
member.remarks: These mappings will replace any mappings that this cache had for any of the keys currently in the specified dictionary.
member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Release
member.summary: Release local resources associated with this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Releasing a cache makes it no longer usable, but does not affect the cache itself. In other words, all other references to the cache will still be valid, and the cache data is not affected by releasing the reference. Any attempt to use this reference afterword will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Destroy
member.summary: Release and destroy this instance of INamedCache.

remarks.p: Warning: This method is used to completely destroy the specified cache across the cluster. All references in the entire cluster to this cache will be invalidated, the cached data will be cleared, and all resources will be released.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Lock(System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item within the specified period of time.

remarks.p: The item doesn't have to exist to be locked. While the item is locked there is known to be a lock holder which has an exclusive right to modify (calling put and remove methods) that item.
Lock holder is an abstract concept that depends on the IConcurrentCache implementation. For example, holder could be a cluster member or a thread (or both).

Locking strategy may vary for concrete implementations as well. Lock could have an expiration time (this lock is sometimes called a "lease") or be held indefinitely (until the lock holder terminates).
Some implementations may allow the entire map to be locked. If the map is locked in such a way, then only a lock holder is allowed to perform any of the "put" or "remove" operations.
Passing the special constant as the key parameter to indicate the cache lock is not allowed for SafeNamedCache and will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked within the specified time; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Lock(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt to lock the specified item and return immediately.
member.remarks: This method behaves exactly as if it simply performs the call Lock(key, 0).
member.param: Key being locked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.Unlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Unlock the specified item.
member.remarks: The item doesn't have to exist to be unlocked. If the item is currently locked, only the holder of the lock could successfully unlock it.
member.param: Key being unlocked.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully unlocked; false otherwise.

member.summary: Invoke the passed against the entries specified by the passed keys, returning the result of the invocation for each.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Impl.SafeNamedCache.InvokeAll(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IEntryProcessor)
member.summary: Invoke the passed against the set of entries that are selected by the given , returning the result of the invocation for each.

remarks.p: Unless specified otherwise, IInvocableCache implementations will perform this operation in two steps: (1) use the filter to retrieve a matching entry collection; (2) apply the agent to every filtered entry. This algorithm assumes that the agent's processing does not affect the result of the specified filter evaluation, since the filtering and processing could be performed in parallel on different threads.
If this assumption does not hold, the processor logic has to be idempotent, or at least re-evaluate the filter. This could be easily accomplished by wrapping the processor with the .

member.param: An that results in the collection of keys to be processed.
The to use to process the specified keys.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the results of invoking the IEntryProcessor against the keys that are selected by the given IFilter.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel
member.summary: An IChannel is a communication construct that allows one or more threads to send and receive objects via a .
member.remarks:
IChannel objects are created from an IConnection. Once created, an IChannel can be used to:
asynchronously send an IMessage
asynchronously send an IRequest
synchronously send an IRequest
asynchronously receive an IMessage
Once an IChannel has been closed, any attempt to send a IMessage using the IChannel may result in an exception.
All IChannel implementations must be fully thread-safe.
member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.23
Ana Cikic 2006.08.15

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IChannel.Close
member.summary: Close the IChannel and reclaim all resources held by the IChannel.

remarks.p: When this method is invoked, it will not return until IMessage processing has been shut down in an orderly fashion. This means that the object associated with this IChannel (if any) have finished processing and that all pending requests are completed or canceled. If the IReceiver is processing an IMessage at the time when close is invoked, all the facilities of the IChannel must remain available until it finishes.
If the IChannel is not open, calling this method has no effect.

member.param: The name with which the object was bound.
member.returns: The object bound with the given name or null if no such binding exists.

remarks.p: The keys of the map are the names with which the corresponding values have been bound to the IChannel.

member.returns: A map of attributes bound to this IChannel.

IChannel attributes are local to the binding peer's IChannel. In other words, attributes bound to this IChannel object will not be bound to the peer's IChannel object.

member.param: The name with which to bind the object
The object to bind.
member.returns: The object that the newly bound object replaced (if any).

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnection
member.summary: An IConnection represents a bi-directional communication channel for exchanging objects between two endpoints.

remarks.p: An IConnection is created by an running on a client. Before an IConnection can be established, the server must initialize and start an . Creating the IConnection results in a handshake between the client and the server (including negotiation); if the handshake is successful, the IConnection will be transitioned to the open state.

An IConnection itself is not used to send and receive IMessage objects. Rather, one or more objects may be created from the IConnection and used to exchange IMessage objects of a known IProtocol with a peer. An IChannel may be opened to a named registered by the peer. Alternatively, an "anonymous" IChannel (a back-Channel) may be created by one peer and returned to the other, where it must be accepted before it can be used.

Once finished with the IConnection, an application should release all resources held by the IConnection by calling the method. Closing an IConnection also closes all IChannel objects created by the IConnection and renders the IConnection unusable. Attempting to use a closed IConnection or any IChannel created by a closed IConnection may result in an exception.
All IConnection implementations must be fully thread-safe.

member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.22
Ana Cikic 2006.08.16

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnection.Close
member.summary: Close the IConnection.

remarks.p: Closing an IConnection also reclaims all resources held by the IConnection, so there is no need to close IChannel objects of a closed IConnection.
If the IConnection is already closed, calling this method has no effect.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnection.OpenChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IProtocol,System.String,Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver,System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Create an IChannel using a specific IProtocol through this IConnection to a named IReceiver on the other end of the IConnection, optionally providing an IPrincipal to indicate the identity that will be utilizing the IChannel, and optionally providing an IReceiver that will process unsolicited IMessage objects on this end of the IChannel.
member.remarks: Conceptually, this is how an IChannel is established to an existing named "service" (e.g. an IReceiver) on the peer; note that either peer can register named services and either peer can use this method to find a named service on its peer.
member.param: The IProtocol that will be used to communicate through the IChannel; the IProtocol is used to verify that the IReceiver on the peer with the specified name is capable of communicating using that IProtocol.

The name that the IReceiver was registered with, on the other end of this IConnection; an IReceiver with the specified name must have been registered with the peer's IConnectionManager prior to calling this method (see ).
An optional IReceiver to associate with this IChannel that will process any unsolicited IMessage objects sent back through the IChannel by the peer.

An optional IPrincipal to associate with this IChannel; if specified, any operation performed upon receipt of an IMessage sent using the returned IChannel will be done on behalf of the specified IPrincipal.
member.returns: A new IChannel object.
member.exception: If the specified IProtocol has not been registered with the underlying IConnectionManager.
If an IReceiver with the given name has not been registered with the peer's IConnectionManager.
If the specified IReceiver does not use the same IProtocol as the one registered on the peer.
If the specified IReceiver does not use the specified IProtocol.
If the IConnection is not open.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnection.CreateChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IProtocol,Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver)
member.summary: Create a back-Channel to expose another service to the peer.

remarks.p: This method is particularly useful for building a Response Message to send back a new IChannel that can be used by the peer. In practice, this means that when a call to a stub is made, it can easily return a new stub that has its own IChannel; for example, a stub representing one service can return a stub representing a different service.
The new IChannel cannot be used until the returned Uri is accepted by the peer.

member.param: The IProtocol that will be used to communicate through the new IChannel.
An optional IReceiver to associate with the new IChannel that will process any unsolicited IMessage objects sent back through the IChannel by the peer.
member.returns: A Uri that represents the new IChannel object.
member.exception: If the specified IProtocol has not been registered with the underlying IConnectionManager.
If the specified IReceiver does not use the specified IProtocol.
If the IConnection is not open.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnection.AcceptChannel(System.Uri,Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver,System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Accept a newly created back-Channel that was spawned by the peer.
member.remarks: Before a spawned IChannel can be used to send and receive IMessage objects, its Uri must be accepted by the peer.
member.param: The Uri of an IChannel that was spawned by the peer.
An optional IReceiver to associate with the new IChannel that will process any unsolicited IMessage objects sent back through the IChannel by the peer.

An optional IPrincipal to associate with the new IChannel; if specified, any operation performed upon receipt of an IMessage sent using the accepted IChannel will be done on behalf of the specified IPrincipal.
member.returns: The newly accepted IChannel.
member.exception: If the specified IReceiver does not use the same IProtocol as the spawned IChannel (as described by its Uri).
If the IConnection is not open.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnectionAcceptor
member.summary: An IConnectionAcceptor represents an running on a server, and as a server, it is responsible for accepting a connection request initiated by a .

remarks.p: Before a connection can be accepted, the IConnectionAcceptor must be started using the method. Calling this method allocates any necessary resources and transitions the IConnectionAcceptor to the running state. The IConnectionAcceptor will then accept new connections, which are represented by object. The IConnectionAcceptor maintains references to accepted IConnection objects until they are closed or the IConnectionAcceptor is or terminated. Terminating a IConnectionAcceptor also closes all accepted IConnection objects.
All IConnectionAcceptor implementations must be fully thread-safe.

member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.23
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnectionManager
member.summary: The IConnectionManager is the base SPI (Service Provider Interface) for both and implementations.

remarks.p: Implementations of this interface use a provider-specific mechanism to establish a bi-directional communication channel between two endpoints, represented by an . Some implementations restrict data transfer between endpoints within a single JVM, whereas others enable two processes to exchange data. Advanced implementations allow communication between processes on different machines, for example using TCP sockets or JMS.

Before an IConnection can be established between a IConnectionInitiator (client) and IConnectionAcceptor (server), one or more instances must be registered with the IConnectionManager on each. During IConnection establishment, the IConnectionInitiator sends information about each registered IProtocol. A compatable set of IProtocol instances (or superset) must be registered with the acceptor's IConnectionManager in order for the IConnection to be established.

Establishing an IConnection is assumed to be a heavyweight operation that may allocate significant resources within and outside the JVM. For example, a TCP-based implementation of this interface may implement an IConnection using a persistent Socket connection with a remote server. However, once established, successive uses of the same IConnection should be relatively lightweight. In other words, an IConnection object, once opened, should appear to be persistent from the perspective of the user until closed. Additionally, underlying transports used by implementations must be both reliable and ordered.
Once an IConnection is established, either client or server may open an to an registered by its peer and use it to send and receive objects to/from the peer.

member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.30
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.name: T:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnectionInitiator
member.summary: An IConnectionInitiator represents an running on a client, and as a client, it is responsible for initiating the connection process.

remarks.p: Before a connection can be established, the IConnectionInitiator must be started using the method. Calling this method allocates any necessary resources and transitions the IConnectionInitiator to the running state. Additionally, the server endpoint must have initialized and started a . The IConnectionInitiator can then be used to establish a connection to the server's IConnectionAcceptor, which is represented by a single object, obtained by calling . The IConnectionInitiator maintains a reference to the IConnection object until it is closed or the IConnectionInitiator is or terminated.
All IConnectionInitiator implementations must be fully thread-safe.

member.author: Jason Howes 2006.03.2
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.08.15

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IConnectionInitiator.EnsureConnection
member.summary: Create a new or return the existing IConnection object.

remarks.p: An IConnection object has a one-way state transition from open to closed; this method will always return an open IConnection object. If the previously existing IConnection object has transitioned to a closed state, this method will return a new IConnectin object in the open state.

member.returns: An IConnection object representing a client's connection to a server.
member.exception: If the IConnectionInitiator is not running.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Channel.Close
member.summary: Close the Channel and reclaim all resources held by the Channel.

remarks.p: When this method is invoked, it will not return until IMessage processing has been shut down in an orderly fashion. This means that the object associated with this Channel (if any) have finished processing and that all pending requests are completed or canceled. If the IReceiver is processing an IMessage at the time when close is invoked, all the facilities of the Channel must remain available until it finishes.
If the Channel is not open, calling this method has no effect.

member.summary: The implementation method. This method is called on the service thread.
member.param: if true, notify the peer that the IChannel is being closed.
The optional reason why the IChannel is being closed.
The number of milliseconds to wait for the IChannel to close; pass 0 to perform a non-blocking close or -1 to wait forever.
member.returns: true if the invocation of this method closed the IChannel.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Channel.Serialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize a user type instance to a POF stream by writing its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for writing out an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must set the version by calling .
The implementation may write any combination of the properties of the user type by using the "write" methods of the IPofWriter, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been written, the implementation must terminate the writing of the user type by calling .
member.param: The with which to write the object's state.
The object to serialize.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Channel.Deserialize(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofReader)
member.summary: Deserialize a user type instance from a POF stream by reading its state using the specified object.
member.remarks:
An implementation of IPofSerializer is required to follow the following steps in sequence for reading in an object of a user type:
If the object is evolvable, the implementation must get the version by calling .
The implementation may read any combination of the properties of the user type by using "read" methods of the IPofReader, but it must do so in the order of the property indexes.
After all desired properties of the user type have been read, the implementation must terminate the reading of the user type by calling .
member.param: The with which to read the object's state.
member.returns: The deserialized user type instance.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.summary: Return an that can be used to serialize and deserialize an object of the specified user type to and from a POF stream.
member.param: The type identifier of the user type that can be serialized and deserialized using the returned IPofSerializer; must be non-negative.
member.returns: An IPofSerializer for the specified user type.
member.exception: If the specified user type is negative or unknown to this IPofContext.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.MAX_PENDING_CHANNELS
member.summary: The maximum number of pending new IChannel objects. If the limit is reached, a pending IChannel will be discarded.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize channel maps and create new Connection.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.Close
member.summary: Close the Connection.

remarks.p: Closing a Connection also reclaims all resources held by the Connection, so there is no need to close IChannel objects of a closed Connection.
If the Connection is already closed, calling this method has no effect.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.Close(System.Boolean,System.Exception)
member.summary: Close the Connection.
member.param: If true, notify the peer that the Connection is being closed.
The optional reason why the Connection is being closed.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.Close(System.Boolean,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Close the Connection.
member.param: If true, notify the peer that the Connection is being closed.
The optional reason why the Connection is being closed.

if true wait for the ConnectionManager to close the Connection when called on a client thread. This method will always wait for the ConnectionManager to close the Connection if called on the service thread.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.CloseInternal(System.Boolean,System.Exception,System.Int32)
member.summary: The implementation method.
member.remarks: This method is called on the service thread.
member.param: if true, notify the peer that the Connection is being closed.
The optional reason why the Connection is being closed.
The number of milliseconds to wait for the Connection to close; pass 0 to perform a non-blocking close or -1 to wait forever.
member.returns: true if the invocation of this method closed the Connection.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Net.Messaging.Impl.Connection.OpenChannel(Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IProtocol,System.String,Tangosol.Net.Messaging.IReceiver,System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Create an IChannel using a specific IProtocol through this IConnection to a named IReceiver on the other end of the IConnection, optionally providing an IPrincipal to indicate the identity that will be utilizing the IChannel, and optionally providing an IReceiver that will process unsolicited IMessage objects on this end of the IChannel.
member.remarks: Conceptually, this is how an IChannel is established to an existing named "service" (e.g. an IReceiver) on the peer; note that either peer can register named services and either peer can use this method to find a named service on its peer.
member.param: The IProtocol that will be used to communicate through the IChannel; the IProtocol is used to verify that the IReceiver on the peer with the specified name is capable of communicating using that IProtocol.

The name that the IReceiver was registered with, on the other end of this IConnection; an IReceiver with the specified name must have been registered with the peer's IConnectionManager prior to calling this method (see ).
An optional IReceiver to associate with this IChannel that will process any unsolicited IMessage objects sent back through the IChannel by the peer.

An optional IPrincipal to associate with this IChannel; if specified, any operation performed upon receipt of an IMessage sent using the returned IChannel will be done on behalf of the specified IPrincipal.
member.returns: A new IChannel object.
member.exception: If the specified IProtocol has not been registered with the underlying IConnectionManager.
If an IReceiver with the given name has not been registered with the peer's IConnectionManager.
If the specified IReceiver does not use the same IProtocol as the one registered on the peer.
If the specified IReceiver does not use the specified IProtocol.
If the IConnection is not open.

member.summary: The implementation method.
member.remarks: This method is called on the service thread.

The name that the IReceiver was registered with, on the other end of this IConnection; an IReceiver with the specified name must have been registered with the peer's IConnectionManager prior to calling this method (see ).
An optional ISerializer to associate with this IChannel.
An optional IReceiver to associate with this IChannel that will process any unsolicited IMessage objects sent back through the IChannel by the peer.

An optional IPrincipal to associate with this IChannel; if specified, any operation performed upon receipt of an IMessage sent using the returned IChannel will be done on behalf of the specified IPrincipal.
An optional token representing IPrincipal to associate with this IChannel.

member.summary: The recipient implementation method.
member.remarks: This method is called on the service thread in response to a ChannelOpenRequest.

member.returns: The identifier of the newly opened Channel.
