member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim
member.summary: ThreadGateSlim exposes a ReaderWriterLockSlim through the Gate interface.
member.author: Charlie Helin 2010.09.10

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.Close(System.Int64)
member.summary: Tries to acquire the exclusive lock, the attempt is willing to wait up the specified millis or -1 to wait infinite.
member.param: If the value is positive the caller will block for this long until either the lock has been acquired. If 0 an immediate attempt is made. If -1 wait an infinite time for the lock to be acquired.
member.returns: true if the lock has been acquired.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.Open
member.summary:
Releases the exclusive lock. If the exclusive lock has no more matching Close(millis) the exclusive lock is released. Any Threads waiting to Enter(millis) or Close(millis) will continue executing.
If the thread currently is also holding the non-exclusive lock, the thread will immediately Enter the lock. The thread will have to match all calls to Enter(millis) with the corresponding count of Exit().

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.Enter(System.Int64)
member.summary: Tries to acquire the non-exclusive lock, the attempt is willing to wait up the specified millis or -1 to wait infinite.
member.param: If the value is positive the caller will block for this long until either the lock has been acquired. If 0 an immediate attempt is made. If -1 wait an infinite time for the lock to be acquired.
member.returns: true if the lock has been acquired.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.Exit
member.summary: Releases the non-exclusive lock. If the non-exclusive lock has no more matching Enter(millis) from any thread the exclusive lock is released so that threads wanting to Close the Gate can proceed.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.m_lock
member.summary: The actual read lock implementation.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.IsEnteredByCurrentThread
member.summary: Determines if the current thread has Entered, but not yet Exited the Gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateSlim.IsClosedByCurrentThread
member.summary: Determines if the current thread has Closed the Gate but not yet Opened the Gate.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor
member.summary: Composite implementation based on an array of extractors.

remarks.p: All extractors in the array are applied to the same target object and the result of the extraction is an IList of extracted values.

Common scenarios for using the MultiExtractor involve the or aggregators, that allow clients to collect all distinct combinations of a given set of attributes or collect and run additional aggregation against the corresponding groups of entries.

member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2006.02.08
Ivan Cikic 2006.10.20

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.#ctor(Tangosol.Util.IValueExtractor[])
member.summary: Construct a MultiExtractor.
member.param: The array.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a MultiExtractor for a specified member name list.
member.param: A comma-delimited sequence of member names which results in a MultiExtractor that is based on a corresponding array of objects; individual array elements will be either or objects

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.Extract(System.Object)
member.summary: Extract a collection of values from the passed object using the underlying array of objects.
member.remarks: Note that each individual value could be an object of a standard wrapper type (for intrinsic types) or null.
member.param: An Object to retrieve the collection of values from.
member.returns: A List containing the extracted values or null if the target object itself is null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.ExtractFromEntry(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheEntry)
member.summary: Extract a collection of values from the passed entry using the underlying array of IValueExtractor objects.
member.param: An entry to retrieve the collection of values from
member.returns: An array containing extracted values

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.CompareEntries(Tangosol.Net.Cache.IQueryCacheEntry,Tangosol.Net.Cache.IQueryCacheEntry)
member.summary: Compare two entries based on the rules specified by IComparer.

remarks.p: If possible, use the method to optimize the value extraction process.

This method is expected to be implemented by IComparer wrappers, which simply pass on this invocation to the wrapped IComparer objects if they too implement this interface, or to invoke their default compare method passing the actual objects (not the extracted values) obtained from the extractor using the passed entries.

This interface is also expected to be implemented by implementations that implement the IComparer interface. It is expected that in most cases, the IComparer wrappers will eventually terminate at (i.e. delegate to) IValueExtractors that also implement this interface.

member.param: The first entry to compare values from; read-only.
The second entry to compare values from; read-only.
member.returns: A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first entry denotes a value that is is less than, equal to, or greater than the value denoted by the second entry.
member.exception: If the arguments' types prevent them from being compared by this IComparer.
If the extractor cannot handle the passed objects for any other reason; an implementor should include a descriptive message.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Extractor.MultiExtractor.CreateExtractors(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a comma-delimited sequence of method names and instantiate a corresponding array of objects.
member.remarks: Individual array elements will be either or objects.
member.param: A comma-delimited sequence of method names
member.returns: An array of objects.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.#ctor(Tangosol.Util.IFilter[])
member.summary: Construct a logical filter that applies a binary operator to a filter array.
member.remarks:
The result is defined as:
filters[0] <op> filters[1] ... <op> filters[n]
member.param: The filter array.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.Evaluate(System.Object)
member.summary: Apply the test to the object.
member.param: An object to which the test is applied.
member.returns: true if the test passes, false otherwise.

member.summary: Apply the test to an .
member.param: The ICacheEntry to evaluate; never null.
member.returns: true if the test passes, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ArrayFilter.WeightedFilter.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this WeightedFilter with the specified WeightedFilter for order. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this WeightedFilter's effectiveness is less than, equal to, or greater than the effectiveness of the specified WeightedFilter object.
member.param: The Object to be compared
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than obj. Zero This instance is equal to obj. Greater than zero This instance is greater than obj.
member.exception: System.ArgumentException: obj is not the same type as this instance.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Filter.BetweenFilter
member.summary: which compares the result of a member invocation with a value for "Between" condition.
member.remarks: We use the standard ISO/IEC 9075:1992 semantic, according to which "X between Y and Z" is equivalent to "X >= Y && X <= Z". In a case when either result of a member invocation or a value to compare are equal to null, the Evaluate test yields false. This approach is equivalent to the way the null values are handled by SQL.
member.author: Cameron Purdy/Gene Gleyzer 2002.10.29
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.10.20
Jonathan Knight 2014.04.28

A flag indicating whether values matching the upper bound of the range evaluate to true

member.summary: Apply the test to an .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.BetweenFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.BetweenFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventSyntheticMask
member.summary: Event natural/synthetic mask enum.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventSyntheticMask.Synthetic
member.summary: This value indicates that synthetic events should be evaluated.
member.remarks: A synthetic event is emitted as a result of internal processing such as expiration, eviction, or read-through.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventSyntheticMask.Natural
member.summary: This value indicates that natural events should be evaluated.
member.remarks: A natural event is emitted as a result of a cache mutation.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventSyntheticMask.All
member.summary: This value indicates that both synthetic and natural events should be evaluated.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask
member.summary: Event mask enum.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.Inserted
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated.
member.remarks: The event will be fired if there is no filter specified or the filter evaluates to true for a new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.Updated
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated.
member.remarks: The event will be fired if there is no filter specified or the filter evaluates to true when applied to either old or new value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.Deleted
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated.
member.remarks: The event will be fired if there is no filter specified or the filter evaluates evaluates to true for an old value.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.UpdatedEntered
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated, but only if filter evaluation is false for the old value and true for the new value.
member.remarks: This corresponds to an item that was not in a Keys filter result changing such that it would now be in that Keys filter result.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.UpdatedLeft
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated, but only if filter evaluation is true for the old value and false for the new value.
member.remarks: This corresponds to an item that was in a Keys filter result changing such that it would no longer be in that Keys filter result.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.UpdatedWithin
member.summary: This value indicates that events should be evaluated, but only if filter evaluation is true for both the old and the new value.
member.remarks: This corresponds to an item that was in a Keys filter result changing but not leaving the Keys filter result.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.All
member.summary: This value indicates that all events should be evaluated.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.Filter.CacheEventFilter.CacheEventMask.Keys
member.summary: This value indicates that all events that would affect the result of an ICache.Keys query should be evaluated.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ContainsFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.ContainsFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Filter.GreaterEqualsFilter
member.summary: which compares the result of a member invocation with a value for "Greater or Equal" condition.
member.remarks: In a case when either result of a member invocation or a value to compare are equal to null, the Evaluate test yields false. This approach is equivalent to the way the null values are handled by SQL.

If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LessEqualsFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LessEqualsFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LikeFilter
member.summary: which compares the result of a member invocation with a value for pattern match.
member.remarks:
A pattern can include regular characters and wildcard characters '_' and '%'.
During pattern matching, regular characters must exactly match the characters in an evaluated string. Wildcard character '_' (underscore) can be matched with any single character, and wildcard character '%' can be matched with any string fragment of zero or more characters.
member.author: Cameron Purdy/Gene Gleyzer 2002.10.27
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.10.24
Tom Beerbower 2009.03.09

member.summary: Switch to the previous page.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.ExtractPage(System.Object[])
member.summary: Extract a subset of the specified array to fit the filter's parameters (i.e. page size and page number).
member.remarks:
If this filter has a comparator, the specified array is presumed to be sorted accordingly.
The returned array is guaranteed to iterate exactly in the same order as the original array.
member.param: An original array of entries.
member.returns: An array of entries extracted accordingly to the filter parameters.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.ExtractPage(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Extract a subset of the specified set to fit the filter's parameters (i.e. page size and page number).
member.remarks:
If this filter has a comparator, the specified ICollection is presumed to be sorted accordingly.
The returned set is guaranteed to iterate exactly in the same order as the original set.
member.param: An original set of entries.
member.returns: A set of entries extracted accordingly to the filter parameters.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.ExtractPage(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Extract a subset of the specified iterator to fit the filter's parameters (i.e. page size and page number).
member.remarks: The returned array is guaranteed to iterate exactly in the same order as the original iterator.
member.param: An original entry iterator.
member.returns: An array of entries extracted accordingly to the filter parameters

member.param: The IPofReader from which to read the object's state.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.WriteExternal(Tangosol.IO.Pof.IPofWriter)
member.summary: Save the contents of a POF user type instance by writing its state using the specified object.
member.param: The IPofWriter to which to write the object's state.
member.exception: If an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.LimitFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.XorFilter.CalculateEffectiveness(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Given an IDictionary of available indexes, determine if this IIndexAwareFilter can use any of the indexes to assist in its processing, and if so, determine how effective the use of that index would be.

remarks.p: The returned value is an effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys. An operation that requires no more than a single access to the index content (i.e. Equals, NotEquals) has an effectiveness of one. Evaluation of a single entry is assumed to have an effectiveness that depends on the index implementation and is usually measured as a constant number of the single operations. This number is referred to as evaluation cost.
If the effectiveness of a filter evaluates to a number larger than the keys.size() then a user could avoid using the index and iterate through the keys calling Evaluate rather than ApplyIndex.

member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The set of keys that will be filtered; read-only.
member.returns: An effectiveness estimate of how well this filter can use the specified indexes to filter the specified keys.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Filter.XorFilter.ApplyIndex(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Filter remaining keys using an IDictionary of available indexes.
member.remarks: The filter is responsible for removing all keys from the passed set of keys that the applicable indexes can prove should be filtered. If the filter does not fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, it must return a filter (which may be an ) that can complete the task using an iterating implementation. If, on the other hand, the filter does fully evaluate the remaining keys using just the index information, then it should return null to indicate that no further filtering is necessary.
member.param: The available objects keyed by the related IValueExtractor; read-only.
The mutable set of keys that remain to be filtered.
member.returns: An object that can be used to process the remaining keys, or null if no additional filter processing is necessary.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Listeners
member.summary: Provide a simple, efficient, and thread-safe implementation of a list of event listeners.

remarks.p: The implementation is optimized based on the assumption that listeners are added and removed relatively rarely, and that the list of listeners is requested relatively often.
Thread safety is implemented by synchronizing on all methods that modify any data member of the class. Read-only methods are not synchronized.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.LiteDictionary
member.summary: An implementation of IDictionary that is optimal (in terms of both size and speed) for very small sets of data but still works excellently with large sets of data.

remarks.p: This implementation is not thread-safe.
The LiteDictionary implementation switches at runtime between several different sub-implementations for storing the IDictionary of objects, described here:

list.item: "empty dictionary" - a dictionary that contains no data;
"single entry" - a reference directly to a single dictionary entry;

"delegation" - for more than items, a dictionary is created to delegate the dictionary management to; sub-classes can override the default delegation class Hashtable by overriding the factory method .

remarks.p: The LiteDictionary implementation supports the null key value.

member.author: Cameron Purdy 1999.06.29
Goran Milosavljevic 2006.09.11

member.summary: Concrete extension that logs messages using the Common.Logging logging library.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Logging.LogOutput
member.summary: Abstract component used to log formatted messages to an underlying logging mechanism.
member.remarks:
Concrete subclasses must implement the three abstract Log methods:
Log(Object level, String message, Exception exception) Log(Object level, String message) Log(Object level, Exception exception)
Additionally, a concrete LogOutput must be able to translate between internal Logger Log levels (see the Logger class for details on the various levels) and equivalent Log level objects appropriate for the underlying logging mechanism. See the method for additional details.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Logging.Logger
member.summary: A Logger class is used to to asynchronously log messages for a specific system or application component.
member.remarks:
Each Logger instance has an associated logging level. Only Log messages that meet or exceed this level are logged. Currently, the Logger defines 10 logging levels (from highest to lowest level):
LEVEL_INTERNAL (All messages without a Log level) LEVEL_ERROR (Error messages) LEVEL_WARNING (Warning messages) LEVEL_INFO (Informational messages) LEVEL_D4 (Debug messages) LEVEL_D5 LEVEL_D6 LEVEL_D7 LEVEL_D8 LEVEL_D9
Additionally, the Logger defines two "psuedo" levels that instruct the Logger to either log all messages or to not log any messages:
LEVEL_ALL LEVEL_NONE
Log messages are logged using the Log() method. There are several versions of the Log() method that allow both string messages and Exception stack traces to be logged. The Logger uses a string template to format the Log message before it is logged using the underlying logging mechanism. The template may contain the following parameterizable strings:
{date} -the date and time that the message was logged {level} -the level of the Log message {thread} -the thread that logged the message {text} -the text of the message {product} -the executing assembly product {version} -the executing assembly version
Subclasses of the Logger are free to define additional parameters.
The Logger class uses a to log messages to an underlying logging mechanism, such as Out, Error, a file. See the Configure() method for additional detail.
member.author: Goran Milosavljevic 2006.09.19

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Logging.Logger.Configure(Tangosol.Net.IOperationalContext)
member.summary: Configure a newly created Logger instance using the supplied OperationalContext.
member.remarks:
destination -specifies the output device used by the logging system; can be one of Error, Out, a file name
severity-level -specifies which logged messages are to be displayed
message-format -specifies how messages that have a logging level specified will be formatted in the Log
character-limit -specifies the maximum number of characters that the logger daemon will process from the message queue before discarding all remaining messages in the queue
See the coherence.xsd for additional documentation for each of these parameters.

character-limit -specifies the maximum number of characters that the logger daemon will process from the message queue before discarding all remaining messages in the queue

member.param: IXmlElement with configuration information.
member.returns: New Logger instance configured using supplied xml configuration.

member.summary: Determine if the ILongArray contains the specified element.
member.remarks: More formally, returns true if and only if this ILongArray contains at least one element e such that (o==null ? e==null : o.Equals(e)).
member.param: Element whose presence in this list is to be tested.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.LongSortedList.GetEnumerator(System.Int64)
member.summary: Obtain an IEnumerator of the contents of the ILongArray, starting at a particular index such that the first call to MoveNext will set the location of the enumerator at the first existent index that is greater than or equal to the specified index, or will throw an IndexOutOfRangeException if there is no such existent index.
member.param: The ILongArray index to iterate from.
member.returns: An instance of IEnumerator.
member.exception: If index greater than or equal to the specified index does not exist.

member.summary: A ICache that contains nothing and does nothing.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullCache.GetAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Get the values for all the specified keys, if they are in the cache.

remarks.p: For each key that is in the cache, that key and its corresponding value will be placed in the dictionary that is returned by this method. The absence of a key in the returned dictionary indicates that it was not in the cache, which may imply (for caches that can load behind the scenes) that the requested data could not be loaded.
The result of this method is defined to be semantically the same as the following implementation, without regards to threading issues:

member.param: A collection of keys that may be in the named cache.
member.returns: A dictionary of keys to values for the specified keys passed in .

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.

remarks.p: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced.

Invoking this method is equivalent to the following call:
Insert(key, value, CacheExpiration.Default);

member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the dictionary previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullCache.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int64)
member.summary: Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache.
member.remarks: If the cache previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced. This variation of the method allows the caller to specify an expiry (or "time to live") for the cache entry.
member.param: Key with which the specified value is to be associated.
Value to be associated with the specified key.

The number of milliseconds until the cache entry will expire, also referred to as the entry's "time to live"; pass to use the cache's default time-to-live setting; pass to indicate that the cache entry should never expire; this milliseconds value is not a date/time value, but the amount of time object will be kept in the cache.
member.returns: Previous value associated with specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key. A null return can also indicate that the cache previously associated null with the specified key, if the implementation supports null values.
member.exception: If the requested expiry is a positive value and the implementation does not support expiry of cache entries.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullCache.InsertAll(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Copies all of the mappings from the specified dictionary to this cache (optional operation).
member.remarks: These mappings will replace any mappings that this cache had for any of the keys currently in the specified dictionary.
member.param: Mappings to be stored in this cache.
member.exception: If the class of a key or value in the specified dictionary prevents it from being stored in this cache.
If the lock could not be succesfully obtained for some key.
This cache does not permit null keys or values, and the specified key or value is null.

member.summary: Add a standard cache listener that will receive all events (inserts, updates, deletes) that occur against the cache, with the key, old-value and new-value included.
member.remarks:
This has the same result as the following call:
AddCacheListener(listener, (IFilter) null, false);
member.param: The to add.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullObservableCache.RemoveCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener)
member.summary: Remove a standard cache listener that previously signed up for all events.
member.remarks:
This has the same result as the following call:
RemoveCacheListener(listener, (IFilter) null);
member.param: The to remove.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullObservableCache.AddCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a cache listener for a specific key.

remarks.p: The listeners will receive objects, but if is passed as true, they might not contain the and properties.

To unregister the ICacheListener, use the
method.

member.param: The to add.
The key that identifies the entry for which to raise events.
true to indicate that the objects do not have to include the OldValue and NewValue property values in order to allow optimizations.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullObservableCache.RemoveCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,System.Object)
member.summary: Remove a cache listener that previously signed up for events about a specific key.
member.param: The listener to remove.
The key that identifies the entry for which to raise events.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullObservableCache.AddCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,Tangosol.Util.IFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a cache listener that receives events based on a filter evaluation.

remarks.p: The listeners will receive objects, but if is passed as true, they might not contain the OldValue and NewValue properties.

To unregister the , use the
method.

member.param: The to add.

A filter that will be passed CacheEventArgs objects to select from; a CacheEventArgs will be delivered to the listener only if the filter evaluates to true for that CacheEventArgs; null is equivalent to a filter that alway returns true.
true to indicate that the objects do not have to include the OldValue and NewValue property values in order to allow optimizations.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.NullImplementation.NullObservableCache.RemoveCacheListener(Tangosol.Net.Cache.ICacheListener,Tangosol.Util.IFilter)
member.summary: Remove a cache listener that previously signed up for events based on a filter evaluation.
member.param: The to remove.
A filter used to evaluate events; null is equivalent to a filter that alway returns true.

member.summary: Conditional entry processor represents a processor that is invoked conditionally based on the result of an entry evaluation.
member.remarks:
If the underlying filter expects to evaluate existent entries only (i.e. entries for which is true, it should be combined with a as follows:
IFilter filterPresent = new AndFilter(new PresentFilter(), filter);

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Processor.ConditionalPut
member.summary: ConditionalPut is an that sets if the specified condition is satisfied.

remarks.p: While the ConditionalPut processing could be implemented via direct key-based operations, it is more efficient and enforces concurrency control without explicit locking.

tr.td: filter = PresentFilter.Instance; cache.Invoke(key, new ConditionalPut(filter, value));
filter = new NotFilter(PresentFilter.Instance); cache.Invoke(key, new ConditionalPut(filter, value));
filter = new EqualsFilter(IdentityExtractor.Instance, valueOld); cache.Invoke(key, new ConditionalPut(filter, valueNew));

remarks.p: Obviously, using more specific, fine-tuned filters (rather than ones based on the may provide additional flexibility and efficiency allowing the put operation to be performed conditionally on values of specific attributes (or even calculations) instead of the entire object.

member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2006.03.15
Ivan Cikic 2006.10.23

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.ConditionalPut.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.ConditionalPut.#ctor(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,System.Object)
member.summary: Construct a ConditionalPut that updates an entry with a new value if and only if the filter applied to the entry evaluates to true.
member.remarks: The result of the invocation does not return any result.
member.param: The filter to evaluate an entry.
A value to update an entry with.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.ConditionalPut.#ctor(Tangosol.Util.IFilter,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct a ConditionalPut that updates an entry with a new value if and only if the filter applied to the entry evaluates to true.
member.remarks: This processor optionally returns the current value as a result of the invocation if it has not been updated (the filter evaluated to false).
member.param: The filter to evaluate an entry.
A value to update an entry with.
Specifies whether or not the processor should return the current value in case it has not been updated.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Processor.ConditionalRemove
member.summary: ConditionalRemove is an that performs an operation if the specified condition is satisfied.

remarks.p: While the ConditionalRemove processing could be implemented via direct key-based operations, it is more efficient and enforces concurrency control without explicit locking.

For example, the following operations are functionally similar, but the IInvocableDictionary versions (a) perform significantly better for partitioned caches; (b) provide all necessary concurrency control (which is ommited from the IQueryCache examples):

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Processor.NumberMultiplier
member.summary: The NumberMultiplier entry processor is used to multiply a property value of a Byte, Int16, Int32, Int64, Single, Double, BigInteger and BigDecimal type.
member.author: Gene Gleyzer 2005.10.31
Ivan Cikic 2006.10.24

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.NumberMultiplier.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.NumberMultiplier.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an NumberMultiplier processor that will multiply a property value by a specified factor, returning either the old or the new value as specified.

remarks.p: The .NET type of the original property value will dictate the way the specified factor is interpreted. For example, applying a factor of Double(0.5) to a property value of Int32(4) will result in a new property value of Int32(2).
If the original property value is null, the .NET type of the numFactor parameter will dictate the .NET type of the new value.

member.param: The property name.
The object representing the magnitude and sign of the multiplier.
Pass true to return the value as it was before it was multiplied, or pass false to return the value as it is after it is multiplied.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.Processor.NumberMultiplier.#ctor(Tangosol.Util.Processor.PropertyManipulator,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an NumberMultiplier processor that will increment a property value by a specified amount, returning either the old or the new value as specified.

remarks.p: The .NET type of the original property value will dictate the way the specified factor is interpreted. For example, applying a factor of Double(0.5) to a property value of Int32(4) will result in a new property value of Int32(2).
If the original property value is null, the .NET type of the numFactor parameter will dictate the .NET type of the new value.

member.param: The ; could be null.
The object representing the magnitude and sign of the multiplier.
Pass true to return the value as it was before it was multiplied, or pass false to return the value as it is after it is multiplied.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.Processor.PreloadRequest
member.summary: PreloadRequest is a simple that gets an property.

remarks.p: No results are reported back to the caller.

The PreloadRequest process provides a means to "pre-load" an entry or a collection of entries into the cache using the cache's loader without incurring the cost of sending the value(s) over the network. If the corresponding entry (or entries) already exists in the cache, or if the cache does not have a loader, then invoking this IEntryProcessor has no effect.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate
member.summary: Use this class in cases that large numbers of threads can operate concurrently with an additional requirement that all threads be blocked for certain operations.
member.author: Cameron Purdy 2003.05.26
Mark Falco 2007.04.27
Ana Cikic 2006.08.29

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates unnamed data slots on threads to store local thread counter values and returns new instance of ThreadGate.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.ToString
member.summary: Provide a human-readable representation of this ThreadGate.
member.returns: A human-readable representation of this ThreadGate.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.BarEntry(System.Int64)
member.summary: Bar entry of the thread gate by other threads, but do not wait for the gate to close.
member.param: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait; pass -1 for forever or 0 for no wait.
member.returns: true iff entry into the thread gate was successfully barred by the calling thread.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Close(System.Int64)
member.summary: Close the thread gate.
member.remarks: A thread uses this method to obtain exclusive access to the resource represented by the thread gate. Each invocation of this method must ultimately have a corresponding invocation of the Open method.
member.param: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait; pass -1 for forever or 0 for no wait.
member.returns: true iff entry into the thread gate was successfully barred by the calling thread and no other threads remain in the gate.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Destroy
member.summary: Destroy the thread gate.
member.remarks: This method can only be invoked if the gate is already closed.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Enter(System.Int64)
member.summary: Enter the thread gate.
member.remarks: A thread uses this method to obtain non-exclusive access to the resource represented by the thread gate. Each invocation of this method must ultimately have a corresponding invocation of the Exit method.
member.param: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait; pass -1 for forever or 0 for no wait.
member.returns: true iff the calling thread successfully entered the gate.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Exit
member.summary: Exit the gate.
member.remarks: A thread must invoke this method corresponding to each invocation of the Enter method.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Open
member.summary: After entry into the ThreadGate is restricted by a call to BarEntry() or Close(), it can be re-opened by calling this method.
member.remarks: Only the thread that called BarEntry() or Close() can call Open().
member.exception: If the gate is not closed or closing or if Open() is not called by the thread that called BarEntry() or Close().

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.GetThreadLocalCount(System.LocalDataStoreSlot)
member.summary: Obtain the long value stored in the LocalDataStoreSlot.
member.param: LocalDataStoreSlot object which provides managed thread local storage with dynamic data slots that are unique to a thread and application-domain combination.
member.returns: Long value stored in the LocalDataStoreSlot.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.SetThreadLocalCount(System.LocalDataStoreSlot,System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the long value to be stored in the LocalDataStoreSlot.
member.param: LocalDataStoreSlot object which provides managed thread local storage with dynamic data slots that are unique to a thread and application-domain combination.
Long value to be stored in the LocalDataStoreSlot.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.IncrementThreadLocalCount(System.LocalDataStoreSlot)
member.summary: Increment the long value from the LocalDataStoreSlot for the current thread by one.
member.remarks: If the value in the LocalDataStoreSlot is null, 1 is returned.
member.param: LocalDataStoreSlot object which provides managed thread local storage with dynamic data slots that are unique to a thread and application-domain combination.
member.returns: The new long value for the current thread or 1 if previous value was null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.DecrementThreadLocalCount(System.LocalDataStoreSlot)
member.summary: Decrement the long value of the LocalDataStoreSlot for the current thread by one.
member.remarks: If the value in the LocalDataStoreSlot is null, -1 is returned.
member.param: LocalDataStoreSlot object which provides managed thread local storage with dynamic data slots that are unique to a thread and application-domain combination.
member.returns: The new long value for the current thread or -1 if previous value was null.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.DoWait(System.Int64)
member.summary: Wait up to the specified number of milliseconds for notification.
member.remarks: Caller must be synchronized.
member.param: Number of milliseconds to wait for.
member.returns: The remaining wait time in milliseconds.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.UpdateStatus(Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState)
member.summary: Update the current thread gate status, without changing the active count.
member.remarks: The caller must hold synchronization on the ThreadGate.
member.param: The new status.
member.returns: The old status.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.STATUS_OFFSET
member.summary: The bit offset at which the ThreadGateStatus is stored within m_atomicState.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.ACTIVE_COUNT_MASK
member.summary: The bit mask covering the portion of m_atomicState used to store the number of unmatched enter calls.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.EMPTY_GATE_OPEN
member.summary: EMPTY_GATE_OPEN: Threads may Enter, Exit, or Close the gates.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.EMPTY_GATE_CLOSING
member.summary: EMPTY_GATE_CLOSING: Closing thread may close the gates, all entered threads have exited.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.EMPTY_GATE_CLOSED
member.summary: EMPTY_GATE_CLOSED: Gates are closed, with no threads inside.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_atomicState
member.summary:
The state of the ThreadGate, including:
bits 0 - 59 store the number of unmatched enter calls bits 60 - 61 store the ThreadGateState value bit 62 - 63 always zero

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_closeCount
member.summary: Number of unmatched completed Close/BarEntry calls.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_threadClosing
member.summary: The thread that is closing the gates.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_versionCount
member.summary: An AtomicCounter that tracks the number of times the gate has transitioned from Closed to Open.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_slotThreadEnterCount
member.summary: Unnamed LocalDataStoreSlot used to store count of unmatched Enter calls per thread.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.m_slotThreadEnterVersion
member.summary: Unnamed LocalDataStoreLost used to store the version number at the time the thread last entered/opened the gate.
member.remarks: Comparing this version number to the m_versionCount, indicates if a thread entering the gate needs to flush memory to be up to date with the last thread which opened the gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.ActiveCount
member.summary: The number of unmatched completed Enter calls.
member.value: The number of unmatched completed Enter calls.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.IsActiveThread
member.summary: Determine if the current thread has entered and not exited the thread gate.
member.remarks: This is useful for detecting re-entrancy.
member.value: true if the current thread has entered and not exited the thread gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.IsClosingThread
member.summary: Determine if the current thread has closed and not opened the the thread gate.
member.remarks: This is useful for detecting re-entrancy.
member.value: true if the current thread has closed and not opened the thread gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.IsEnteredByCurrentThread
member.summary: Determine if the current thread has entered and not exited the thread gate.
member.remarks: This is useful for detecting re-entrancy.
member.value: true if the current thread has entered and not exited the thread gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.IsClosedByCurrentThread
member.summary: Determines if the current thread have Closed the gate but not yet Opened the Gate.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Version
member.summary: The total number of times the gate has been fully opened.
member.remarks: When setting the value, the caller must have the gate closed.
member.value: The total number of times the gate has been fully opened.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.CloseCount
member.summary: The number of unmatched completed Close/BarEntry calls.
member.value: The number of unmatched completed Close/BarEntry calls.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.ClosingThread
member.summary: The thread that is closing the gates.
member.remarks: When setting the value, the caller must be synchronized on the ThreadGate.
member.value: The thread that is closing the gates.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGate.Status
member.summary: The current thread gate status.
member.value: One of the values.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState
member.summary: ThreadGate state enum.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState.Open
member.summary: Threads may enter and exit the gates.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState.Closing
member.summary: A thread is waiting to be the only thread inside the gates; other threads can only exit.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState.Closed
member.summary: A single thread is inside the gates; other threads cannot enter.

member.name: F:Tangosol.Util.ThreadGateState.Destroyed
member.summary: Life-cycle is complete; the object is no longer usable.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.UriUtils.GetSchemeSpecificPart(System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns the decoded scheme-specific part of the Uri.
member.remarks:
At the highest level a URI reference in string form has the syntax:
[scheme:]scheme-specific-part[#fragment]
where square brackets [...] delineate optional components and the characters : and # stand for themselves.
member.param: Uri object.
member.returns: Scheme-specific part of the Uri.

member.summary: If this UUID is being used as a generated UUID but its fields have not yet been initialized, this method ensures that the initialization occurs.
member.remarks: All public methods, except for deserialization methods, must call this method to ensure that the UUID is properly constructed.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Util.UUID.InitHashcode
member.summary: Finish construction or deserialization.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.UUID.IsAddressIncluded
member.summary: This is true if the IP address is a real IP address.

member.name: P:Tangosol.Util.UUID.Count
member.summary: Determine the "counter" portion of the UUID that ensures that two UUIDs generated at the same exact time by the same process are unique.
member.returns: A number that helps to make the UUID unique.

member.name: T:Tangosol.Web.CoherenceSessionStore
member.summary: ASP.NET Session-State Store Provider implementation that uses a Coherence for .NET to store HTTP session state.

remarks.p: This implementation allows you to have a truly clustered session- state store.

The CoherenceSessionStore has the following conditions and features:
Objects stored within a Session must be serializable.
The Session_OnEnd event is supported.

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic 2006.11.02
Jason Howes 2007.03.29

member.name: M:Tangosol.Web.CoherenceSessionStore.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes this session-state store provider by obtaining the INamedCache used to store serialized HTTP session state.
member.param: The friendly name of the provider.
A collection of name/value pairs containing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Web.CoherenceSessionStore.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this session-state store provider.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Web.CoherenceSessionStore.SetItemExpireCallback(System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemExpireCallback)
member.summary: Configure the Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemExpireCallback delegate for the Session_OnEnd event defined in the Global.asax file.
member.param: The Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemExpireCallback delegate for the Session_OnEnd event defined in the Global.asax file.
member.returns: true if the session-state store provider supports calling the Session_OnEnd event; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Tangosol.Web.CoherenceSessionStore.GetItem(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: Returns read-only HTTP session data from the session data store.
member.param: The Web.HttpContext for the current request.
The Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.SessionID for the current request.
When this method returns, contains a Boolean value that is set to true if the requested HTTP session item is locked at the session data store; otherwise, false.
When this method returns, contains a TimeSpan object that is set to the amount of time that an item in the session data store has been locked.

When this method returns, contains an object that is set to the lock identifier for the current request. For details on the lock identifier, see "Locking Session-Store Data" in the
class summary.
When this method returns, contains one of the Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions values, indicating whether the current HTTP session is an uninitialized, cookieless HTTP session.
member.returns: A Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData populated with HTTP session values and information from the session data store.

When this method returns, contains an object that is set to the lock identifier for the current request. For details on the lock identifier, see "Locking Session-Store Data" in the
class summary.
When this method returns, contains one of the Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions values, indicating whether the current HTTP session is an uninitialized, cookieless HTTP session.
